XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, IL XXXX SSN : XXXX DOB : XX/XX/XXXX Date : XX/XX/XXXX To : Credence Resource Management , LLC XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX RE : FORMAL DISPUTE & DEMAND FOR VALIDATION OF ALLEGED ACCOUNT # XXXX {$1100.00} To Whom It May Concern, This letter serves as a formal dispute and demand for full legal validation of the above-referenced alleged debt. I, XXXX XXXX, do not acknowledge nor accept any liability for this account. You are hereby instructed to cease all collection activity and credit reporting until full and proper legal validation is provided. 

Under my rights granted by the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692g, the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681, and the Uniform Commercial Code ( UCC ) 1-308 and 3-501, I demand the following documentation : A copy of the original signed contract with my XXXX signature A binding agreement showing my legal obligation to repay this alleged debt A complete flow sheet or account ledger detailing charges, payments, fees, and interest A full chain of assignment proving lawful transfer from the original creditor to your agency Documentation confirming that this account is not past the statute of limitations under Illinois law Proof of XXXX companys license to collect debts in Illinois, including license XXXX and regulatory authority The name, department, and method of verification used to report this item to any credit bureau A notarized XXXX XXXX a manual investigation was conducted per FCRA 611 and that no eOSCAR automated system was used Let it be absolutely clear : a billing statement, invoice, or summary does not qualify as legal validation. If you are unable to provide all of the above documentation within XXXX calendar days, you must : Delete this account from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX all collection communications and efforts permanently Failure to comply will result in formal complaints to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and the Illinois Attorney XXXX XXXX, and I will pursue civil legal action for violations of FDCPA, FCRA, and XXXX. 

All rights reserved under UCC XXXX, without prejudice. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX : XXXX DOB : XX/XX/XXXX

I am disputing the validity of the debt that is being reported and/or collected. Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692g, I am requesting full validation of this alleged debt.

Specifically, I am requesting : * The name and address of the original creditor.

* The original account number.

* An itemized breakdown of the amount claimed, including principal, interest, fees, and any other charges.

* Documentation that proves you are legally authorized to collect this debt, including a copy of the assignment or contract showing your right to collect. 
* Confirmation of whether this alleged debt has been reported to any credit bureaus, and if so, which ones and what information was furnished. 
Until proper validation is provided, you must cease all collection activity and stop reporting or verifying this debt with any credit reporting agencies, as required by the FDCPA and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 
If you can not provide the requested validation, I am requesting that you immediately stop all collection efforts and remove any negative reporting related to this alleged debt. 
This is not a refusal to pay, but a request for validation and verification of the claim in accordance with my rights under federal law.

I currently have my mortgage with GMFS, serviced by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. I have had continuous problems over the past several months. On XX/XX/2020 I inquired through their web portal about any assistance being offered during the COVID-19 pandemic. I received a response back on XX/XX/2020 advising me of the terms and conditions of a forbearance program and that my account may be eligible. After reviewing the terms and conditions I responded back via the web portal on XX/XX/2020 advising I would not be interested in taking advantage of the forbearance. On XX/XX/2020 I received a response from XXXX XXXX XXXX advising a request had been put in to stop the forbearance. 
I made my payment as scheduled for XXXX ; however, I received a robocall within a couple of days advising my forbearance had been approved. I signed on and noticed the payment I made did not apply towards my monthly payments ; however, to unidentified funds. I sent yet another response on XX/XX/2020 advising them I declined the forbearance and I would like my payment corrected. On XX/XX/XXXX I received a response back stating the cancellation was put in on XX/XX/XXXX for forbearance and that my payment would be applied correctly. Keep in mind, I never authorized this forbearance. At this point I assumed all would be well. The exact same thing happened for XXXX and XXXX. After speaking with a supervisor ( I do not remember the date ) I was advised my account did go through the full three months of forbearance ; however, all payments were posted accordingly. I did have to write in and/or call every month to have my payments corrected. It got so bad that I had one associate tell me over the phone that I had only made a partial payment. All of this was eventually straightened out. After all this is said and done, I now have a forbearance on my record with this company and that is not fair. I specifically said I do not want it. Also, I have tried to set up ACH for the past two months. To this day, I keep getting denial letters for ACH because my account is in " Forbearance ''. Once again, this is unfair, as I now don't have something available to me that other customers have available to them, especially when the account should have never been in forbearance. I have spoken with two associates regarding this and they could not give me a reason as to why the ACH is getting kicked back for forbearance. The management team does not make themselves readily available for escalated situations rather you have to wait on them to call you whenever they have free time. 
I feel as though I am stuck. I can not easily go out and refinance my house as that usually cost a nice chunk of money out of pocket ; therefore, I have to be subjected to the poor service and having things on my record I didn't ask for.

Please consider this letter a formal request for the following : 1. Immediate cessation of all phone calls, letters, or any other forms of communication regarding the debt. 
2. A written statement confirming that you will no longer pursue collection efforts.

I also request that any information regarding this account be reviewed for accuracy, as I dispute the validity of the debt and reserve the right to request further documentation.

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX XX/XX/year> Re : Cease and Desist Unauthorized Access to Consumer Report / Violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681b To Whom It May Concern : This letter serves as formal notice that you must immediately cease and desist from obtaining, using, sharing, or in any way furnishing my personal credit information without my explicit written consent, as required by 15 U.S.C. 1681b of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ).

I have reviewed my credit report and found that your company, [ Company Name ], accessed or furnished my credit information without my authorization or permissible purpose. I have never provided written consent, nor do I have a current relationship with your organization that would lawfully justify such access.

You are hereby ordered to : 1. Cease and desist from any further access or use of my consumer report or personal information. 


2. Provide documentation proving that I gave written authorization for such activity ( if any ).

3. Cease all communication regarding any account, debt, or transaction that is not legally verifiable or authorized.

4. Delete and remove any associated inquiry or record from all consumer reporting agencies to which you furnished it. 



Failure to comply with this cease and desist request may result in legal action, including but not limited to filing complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and/or initiating a private lawsuit for damages under the FCRA. 

You are expected to respond to this letter in writing within 15 business days from the date of receipt. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX Last XXXX digits of XXXX : XXXX Date of Birth : XXXX

On XX/XX/19, I e-signed an Intent to Proceed notice with TD Bank for a mortgage loan. The closing date for this transaction was scheduled for XX/XX/19. My attempts to communicate with the loan officer and loan processor since signing the Intent to Proceed have been largely unsuccessful resulting in missed deadlines and a failure to meet the original closing date. Between XX/XX/19 and XX/XX/19, I sent 6 emails to my loan officer and/or loan processor and not a single one was replied to. Over the same approximate 1-month period, I left 11 voicemail phone messages ( no phone calls were ever answered immediately ). Only three of my calls were returned. I received a conditional approval on XX/XX/19 from the lender. I submitted the required documentation to the best of my ability with minimal to no guidance provided by the lender. Due to lender 's failure to respond to my attempted outreach, at no time was I aware if the submitted documentation would be acceptable. 

The conditional loan approval correctly stated the closing date XX/XX/19. An initial closing disclosure is required by XX/XX/19 in order to close by XX/XX/19. TD Bank did not meet the XX/XX/19 deadline for the closing disclosure. I was informed via email onXX/XX/19( the first email response I received since XX/XX/19 ) that the lender has not performed an employment verification. I was informed by TD Bank that a written verification request was sent to my employer on XX/XX/19, the day the closing disclosure was due. During one of the few successful phone calls on XX/XX/19, I asked the loan processor if any documentation was needed for employment verification. I was informed TD Bank would independently obtain the verification. As of XX/XX/19, to my knowledge the only item which is required to complete underwriting is the written employment verification. However, I can not confirm this is the only requirement for underwriting due to the lack of communication. As of the filing of this complaint, I have not received the completed appraisal, the initial closing disclosure, or even a proposed revised closing date. 

TD Bank has failed to display any good-faith efforts indicating that they attempted to close this loan on-time. Outreaches to the TD Bank loan officer and processor have been almost nonexistent. Outreach to TD Banks customer service line has been successful, however, the amount of assistance they can provide me in limited to what is recorded in the system by the loan officer or processor. As a result of the failure to meet the disclosure deadlines and closing date, I now face potential consequences of monetary damages and a cancellation of sale through no fault of my own.

I need this resolve, under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, these disputed items may not appear on my credit report if they can not be supported by any evidence ( 1 ) In general No person ( company ) shall sell, transfer for consideration, or place for collection a debt that such person has been notified under section 1681c-2 of this title has resulted from identity theft.

( 2 ) Applicability The prohibitions of this subsection shall apply to all persons collecting a debt described in paragraph ( 1 ) after the date of a notification under paragraph ( 1 ).

( 3 ) Rule of construction Nothing in this subsection shall be construed to prohibit -- ( A ) The repurchase of a debt in any case in which the assignee of the debt requires such repurchase because the debt has resulted from identity theft ; ( B ) the securitization of a debt or the pledging of a portfolio of debt as collateral in connection with a borrowing ; or ( C ) the transfer of debt as a result of a merger, acquisition, purchase and assumption transaction, or transfer of substantially all of the assets of an entity.

A person that furnishes information to any consumer reporting agency shall have in place reasonable procedures to respond to any notification that it receives from a consumer reporting agency under section 1681c-2 of this title relating to information resulting from identity theft, to prevent that person from refurnishing such blocked information.

In XXXX, I owed {$38000.00} on my house when I left chapter XXXX bankruptcy. Under advice of my attorney, I did not reaffirm the loan due to house not being worth the loan value. Over the next couple of years, I tried to negotiate with XXXX  XXXX XXXX to keep my house. I filled out several loan modification applications and submitted them to the bank. In XXXX, I hired an attorney to assist with the loan modification process because of their constantly making me redo the application. That same year XXXX  XXXX XXXX foreclosed on my property and during the foreclosure they transferred the loan to Green Tree Servicing. My attorney submitted the application to Green Tree several times and in XXXX, they denied my application. My attorney advised me that Judge XXXX had setup a portal to monitor the banks handling of the process and I was forced back into bankruptcy. We had to make trial payments before being accepted into the process and on XX/XX/XXXX I signed the modification. 

At this same time The FTC entered into a settlement agreement with Green Tree which was signed on or about XX/XX/XXXX. In this agreement Green Tree entered into settlement in part for Green Trees misrepresentation of inaccurate amounts reported against loans they serviced. On XX/XX/XXXX, Green Tree signed the modification and increased my loan from {$38000.00} to {$59000.00}. 

I have not received any money from the settlement even though servicing of my loan by Green Tree fell within that time period during foreclosure they did not honor the in-process loan modification from XXXX  XXXX XXXX. 

We continued to struggle, and we had to have the loan modified again. Our loan was now being handled by Ditech and on XX/XX/XXXX the new modified agreement was increased to {$62.00}, XXXX. 

During the whole time we tried to get Green Tree and/or Ditech to explain why this extra money was added to our account. On XX/XX/XXXX of this year, I had to let the house go and I signed a deed in lieu of foreclosure. When I signed the papers, I was upset because I bought this house when I was XXXX years old and lived in for over 30 years.. I asked for copy of notarized paperwork from the notary who told me that he was under orders not to give me a copy. To date, ditech has never sent me a copy. 
In XXXX, Ditech filed foreclosure against me with my loan now being {$68000.00}. I filed a counter claim against Ditech ( see attachments ). On XX/XX/XXXX I received notice from one of Ditechs attorneys that I have no right to sue for Ditech misrepresenting money owed on my loan and/or previous violations of the FTC settlement which they have intentionally ignored and misrepresented amount of my loan plus reported these inaccurate amounts on my credit report. 

In Summary, when I left bankruptcy in XXXX the loan was {$38000.00}. The court would not approve the amount as it was higher than the actual value of {$20.00} - {$25000.00}. Instead Green Tree/ Ditech have used the loan modification process to obtain more than my loan was valued and more than the bankruptcy court would allow to reaffirm the loan. Furthermore, the Hamp program was offered to consumers to save their home which included the following provisions : 1.  Reduce Mortgage Principal 2. Reduce Interest Rate 3. Temporarily postpone or offer forbearance 4. Extend terms of current loan On XXXX of XXXX, XXXX XXXX   made available to consumers principal reduction modification which I would have been eligible for in the second modification but was never offered in my second loan modification. 

Despite knowledge of the requirements imposed through the Consent Order that was settled on XX/XX/XXXX, Green Tree - Ditech have continued to defrauding consumers by : 1. False representation of amount owed on my property through the loan modifications 2. Failure to abide by the order and issue money to me in accordance with the settlement 3. False or inaccurate information being reported on my credit report 4. Not abiding by modification rules to reduce principal Finally they have misrepresented to the bankruptcy court that they are acting in good faith but they are using the court to cause willful and malicious injury to the consumer by not allowing them due process in filing counter claims to preserve their rights to sue for damages arising out of their continued and willful violation of the Consent Order signed with the FTC on XX/XX/XXXX. 
Please also note the facts and evidence attached with this complaint.

Approximately three months ago ( i.e. XX/XX/2019 ) I began receiving SMS text messages suggesting that I had a delinquent loan. The messages were vague, but after receiving several of them, I called the number from which they originated. The person at the other end identified herself as an employee of Golden Valley Lending, and asserted I had taken a {$700.00} loan from the company she represented. I had, until that day, never heard of Golden Valley Lending, and definitely had not taken a {$700.00} loan from anyone. I said as much and, after a short exchange, determined the call was a phishing scam, and hung up. 

Since that time, I have received not less than 8 calls from Golden Valley Lending per week, originating from numerous different phone numbers. The most recent two are : * (  XXXX ) XXXX * ( XXXX ) XXXX I've blacklisted each new number as I've received the calls, which all adhere to the following format ( paraphrased ) : Golden Valley Lending : "  Is [ My Name ] available '' Me : " This is [ My Name ] '' GVL : " This is [ fill in name ] with Golden Valley Lending. We're calling to discuss the status of your account '' Me : " I do not have an account with you ; I've never opened an account with you. '' GVL : " That's not what our records show. '' Me : " I can't account for your records, but we don't have anything to discuss. '' GVL : " Good luck with that. These calls will continue. '' <call is disconnected> I have repeatedly asked to be removed from their call list, and been denied. I have repeatedly asked for a written record of my debt, and have never seen one.  I have received one printed letter via USPS, again vaguely suggesting I need to address some kind of debt-related issue but without any account number, amount, clear indication that the letter is an attempt to collect a debt, advisory of my rights, etc. It seemed to be merely a form letter that looked like it was designed to get me to call their office. 

I have checked my credit reports with three agencies to confirm no debt has been reported in the amount Golden Valley Lending has asserted. I have received no official attempt to collect a debt, and my credit score remains unblemished even though I've been ignoring these calls, more or less, for months.

Pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) Section 803 ( 6 )  which states that " the term 'debt collector ' means any person who uses any instrumentality of interstate commerce or the mails in any business the principal purpose of which is the collection of any debts, or who regularly collects or attempts to collect, directly or indirectly, debts owed or due or asserted to be owed or due another. Notwithstanding the exclusion provided by clause ( F ) of the last sentence of this paragraph, the term includes any creditor who, in the process of collecting his own debts, uses any name other than his own which would indicate that a third person is collecting or attempting to collect such debts. For the purpose of section 1692f ( 6 ) of this title, such term also includes any person who uses any instrumentality of interstate commerce or the mails in any business the principal purpose of which is the enforcement of security interests. ", " XXXX and XXXX, XXXX '' hereinafter referred to as " the Debt Collection LLC '' is a debt collector. On behalf of the Debt Collection LLC, debt collector XXXX XXXX. XXXX filed a lawsuit ( Civil Action No. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) in XXXX County State Court indicating that he is an attorney which is false and misleading pursuant to FDCPA Section 807 ( 3 ) on XX/XX/2019, on behalf of Capital One Bank ( USA ) N.A. hereinafter referred to as " the Bank '' who is a debt collector pursuant to FDCPA Section 803 ( 6 ). On behalf of the Bank, I was served a summons by the XXXX County Sheriff 's Department who collects debts as a third party on behalf of XXXX County Superior and State Courts hereinafter referred to as " the Debt Collection Courts ''. On behalf of the Debt Collection Courts and the Bank, the service of summons by the XXXX County Sheriff 's Department was unauthorized third party communication to the consumer pursuant to FDCPA Section 805 ( b ). On behalf of the Debt Collection Courts, The XXXX County Sheriff 's Department violated FDCPA Section 807 ( 11 ) by not disclosing in their initial communication with the consumer " that the debt collector is attempting to collect a debt and that any information obtained will be used for that purpose ''. XXXX XXXX XXXX signed the agreement, assumed full liability, and was covered by the program 's comprehensive insurance, which included protection for any damages ( e.g., the alleged cracked windshield ). 
I, XXXX XXXX, was designated as the driver only for operational purposes and was not a party to the lease or rental agreement ; I bear no personal responsibility or liability.

Despite my repeated demands to both XXXX XXXXr and Summit AR for validation documentation ( e.g., the specific contract excerpt proving individual responsibility ), none has been providedbecause no such provision exists under the corporate subscription agreement of at the time XXXX Plus Subscription Model This inaccurate reporting violates FCRA provisions requiring accurate and verifiable information ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) and 1681i ). My wife and I applied for a VA 15 year mortgage through Navy Federal Credit Union in XX/XX/XXXX. More than six weeks later, it was denied for inadequate income. Navy Federal would not consider the more than {$400000.00} in annual income we would receive from the XX/XX/XXXX sale of XXXX XXXX that we owned for more than 30 years. Subsequently, Navy Federal moved us to a conventional, 30 year mortgage at a higher interest rate. 

The failure of Navy Federal to act timely, to look at the source of our income and how long we had that income was unconscionable in our eyes. From day one, it was clear that we had sold our business and our principal source of income was now through a 20 year contract with the employees who bought the business. By the time Navy Federal acted, we were so deep into the process, we were compelled to continue on the path they directed or we would have lost the home. The sellers had grown impatient with the delays. 

Particularly egregious to us was that in reviewing VA lending guidelines, as set out in VA pamphlet 26-7, we should have readily qualified for exceptions to requiring we have our new source of income for 24, as well as 12 months. Prior to starting our own XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, I had worked for the XXXX XXXX XXXX for eleven years. Out of XXXX XXXX, I started with XXXX as a XXXX XXXX and worked my way up to XXXX and XXXX XXXX   XXXX positions before resigning to start XXXX XXXX. With a college education, more than 40 years of work in the field and substantial earnings both before and after the sale of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, we easily met the VA guidelines which clearly set out that decisions as to income should not be mechanically applied, but consider on a case-by-case basis using education, experience and past income and the likelihood it would continue. Over the five years between XXXX and XXXX we averaged annual growth in excess of 30 percent. 

We do not believe Navy Federal acted in a timely manner to deny our claim, thus denying me an opportunity to go with another lender. Furthermore, we believe Navy Federal, through their actions and failure to follow VA guidelines, deliberately directed us to file for a higher rate conventional mortgage, thus allowing Navy Federal to make more money on the loan.

To earn our business over other banks, the Wells Fargo representative assured us that if we took out a loan with them, they would eliminate any prepayment penalty for refinancing with Wells Fargo or making early payments. This information was included in the agreement as instructed by the agent. When we refinanced with Wells Fargo, they charged us over {$100000.00} for a prepayment penalty. To justify their action, they said the new rate would replenish this amount in a short period. I was extremely upset, but with no recourse. RE : Account XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX Dear Sir/Madame : I am writing to dispute the account referenced above. I have disputed this account information as inaccurate with the credit bureaus XXXX  and Experian, and you have been able to verify this debt. How is this possible? This is not my account!

In the event that you can not verify the item pursuant to the FCRA, and you continue to list the disputed item on my credit report I will find it necessary to sue you for improper reporting of information to the credit bureaus regarding my credit history, actual defamation damages and declaratory relief under the FCRA. According to this regulation, I may sue you in any qualified state or federal court, including small claims court in my area. You have severely limited my ability to purchase a home and get a credit card.

In light of the recent changes to the FCRA ( FACTA ), consumers now have the right to go directly to the original creditor and ask for proof of negative information. In addition, court case opinion No. 00-15946 CV-99-00290-D.C. by the US Court of Appeals 9th Circuit, Nelson Vs. Chase Manhattan, the court ruled that the creditor has the responsibility to investigate and make sure that correct information is being reported to the bureaus, and that the consumer has a right to sue under the FCRA, should his or her rights be violated.

While I prefer not to litigate, I will use the courts as needed to enforce my rights under the FCRA. 

I look forward to an uneventful resolution of this matter.

After multiple interactions and finally asking them to pull up the original phone call where we were advised we would get the interest rate reduction, I received an email they could not give us the reduction but they would give us {$50.00} ( the said the reduction would have resulted in {$28.00} savings over the life of the loan ). None of my other concerns were addresses and it was dropped. 

In XXXX we began receiving multiple messages stating we needed flood insurance again. My husband and I spoke with multiple people every week. We continued to be advised we just had to send in our LOMA. We would send it in and they would come back and ask again. They could not ever find our account. We ended up sending it to the person who handled the above complaint hoping she could help on XX/XX/XXXX. We never heard a response. The confusion has something to do with SoFi and the company who services their loans not having the same account number. We sent the flood documentation an estimate of 6 times from XXXX through XXXX ( they would call every couple of weeks, we would send it every couple of weeks ). We then began receiving letters stating they would force us into flood insurance and purchase it for us. At this point I had contacted FEMA asking for help who also advised the LOMA is what we should need to send them. We were not getting any help from anyone to understand what we needed to do. 

XX/XX/XXXX, I emailed the CEO again, I received a generic email from someone saying someone from the mortgage team would get back to me. I never heard anything back. On XX/XX/XXXX I emailed the 'CEO ' again letting them know I would be contacting CFPB because I did not know what else to do. I again received a generic response stating they would be forwarding it to the mortgage team and someone would get back to me. It is now the XXXX and I still have not heard back from anyone. 

We did however receive an email on XX/XX/XXXX notifying us that they had purchased flood insurance using our escrow for {$1700.00}. We have not been advised yet how they will pay our other stuff since our escrow will now not have money in it. I assume we will be getting a bill or something soon. We are begging for help. We thought we were doing everything correctly. We continued to do what we were asked to do which was to send in our LOMA. They would not help us understand what was needed to prevent this and then spent our escrow without our permission. 

We do not know if we need to contact a lawyer or what to do next. We did go back to FEMA and are requesting a new LOMA even though we have been advised LOMA 's do not expire. We are in the waiting process for that. 

At this point we would like to refinance our loan with a different company but can not afford to pay another {$4000.00} closing costs with a different company. We feel we should have been advised prior to closing that we were going to be required to get flood insurance if we refinanced with them or at least had someone help us to understand what they needed before they just spent our escrow. We feel we took this loan out based on false information from SoFi. I do have some emails that I have kept during this process. Please let me know if there is anything else we need to try to resolve this issue. Thank you for your support.

The amount of the alleged debt, including an itemized accounting of fees, interest, or other charges. The name and address of the original creditor, as well as documentation proving that you are authorized to collect this debt on their behalf. Please also be advised : Until you provide the requested validation, you must cease all collection activities, including reporting this debt to credit reporting agencies. Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, CO XXXX Loan # : XXXX Lender : Mr. Cooper ( Nationstar Mortgage LLC ) Statement Date : XX/XX/year> Payoff Good Through : XX/XX/year> Complaint Summary I requested a mortgage payoff statement from Mr. Cooper in XX/XX/year> to complete a refinance. Their Loan Estimate used an understated payoff amount of {$710000.00} when my actual documented payoff amount was {$710000.00}, as confirmed by Mr. Coopers own payoff quote issued XX/XX/year>. 

This inaccurate figure resulted in a misleading Loan Estimate that claimed I would owe no money at closing, which was materially false. I only discovered the real payoff through a separate communication. 

The daily interest shown in their internal calculations also appeared to be incorrect ( based on ~ $ XXXX at XXXX %, when my actual interest rate was 7.125 %, and actual daily interest was {$130.00} ). This again made the refinance look more favorable than it truly was. 

Additionally, they promised a funding date of XX/XX/year>, which another broker confirmed was logistically impossible under federal guidelines, further misleading me into believing their offer could close faster. 

These practices violate the Truth in Lending Act, the RESPA Section 8 ( a ) anti-kickback/misrepresentation rules, and likely state consumer protection statutes governing deceptive lending. 

I am requesting that : The CFPB investigate Mr. Coopers use of intentionally understated payoff quotes in Loan Estimates. 

Mr. Cooper be required to provide corrected disclosures and refrain from using estimates that underrepresent true payoffs. 

A formal record of this complaint be logged with their licensing record and compliance department.

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX NJ XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, NJ XXXX RE : Request for Full Verification and Disclosure of Records Account # XXXX To Whom It May Concern, This letter is in response to your recent communication regarding the alleged debt referenced above. Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I formally request full verification of this alleged debt and all supporting records.

Required Documentation Please provide the following information to fulfill your obligations under federal consumer protection laws : 1. Creditor Information o The name and address of both the original creditor and the current creditor who owns the debt.

2. Debt Verification o A breakdown of the debt amount, including principal, interest, fees, and other charges as required under 12 CFR 1006.34 ( c ).

o Proof of a valid contract or agreement establishing the alleged debt.

3. Itemization Date o Provide the specific reference date you used in your itemization ( such as the last statement date, charge-off date, or last payment date ).

4. Assignment Records o Copies of all assignments or transfers demonstrating the chain of ownership of this debt from the original creditor to your agency.

5. Proof of Permissible Purpose o Explain the permissible purpose under which you accessed my credit report under 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( Fair Credit Reporting Act ).

6. Cease Collection Until Validation Is Provided o If you can not provide proper validation, I request that you cease all collection activities and remove this alleged debt from your records.

7. Communication Records o A record of all communications ( letters, phone calls, emails, texts ) sent to or from your office o Names, job titles, and departments of any individuals who contacted me o Copies of call logs or transcripts ( if available ) 8. System-Generated Documentation o Screenshots, data logs, or reports from your system of record with date/time stamps o Internal notes or dispute handling logs showing how and when this account was processed o Company policies related to account disputes and verification 9. Verification of Responsibility o Names and job titles of personnel responsible for handling this dispute o Dates of any review, verification, or updates to the account Consumer Rights Notice Collection activity must cease until complete verification has been provided. Furthermore, because this account is not currently reporting on my credit report, you are not authorized to report this debt to any credit reporting agency or sell, transfer, or assign this debt to any third party unless and until you have fully validated it as required by law. 
As part of this cease-and-desist request, you are not to contact me via phone call, text message, email, or physical mail. All future communication must be conducted solely via USPS, and only in direct response to this dispute.

Enclosures Copy of your original collection notice ( Dunning Letter ) Copy of my initial dispute letter Copy of the correspondence received from your company Copies of any relevant prior correspondence Proof of delivery/tracking information Please respond within 30 days of your receipt of this letter. Your compliance is required under federal law and will help prevent unnecessary escalation. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX : Recent correspondence from your company for alleged debt.

Subject : Notice of Dispute Inaccurate Charge-Off Reporting for Capital One To Whom It May Concern, I am formally disputing the accuracy of an account being reported on my credit report by Capital One, listed under account number ending in XXXX * * * * * *. This account is currently reported as charged off with a balance of {$2900.00}. 

I believe the reporting of this account as a charge-off is inaccurate, incomplete, and misleading, and I am requesting that you conduct an investigation under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681i.

Reason for Dispute : This account may have been securitizedsold to a trust or third party as part of a pooled asset-backed securitywhich would indicate Capital One no longer legally owns or holds the debt, making it improper for them to report it as a charge-off with an outstanding balance. 

According to the FCRA, all information reported must be complete and accurate. If the debt was sold or otherwise transferred through securitization, Capital One can not legally report it as an ongoing charge-off obligation. 

I am requesting that you : 1. Investigate the accuracy of this charge-off in light of securitization.

2. Request documentation from Capital One proving their legal right to continue reporting this account, including proof of ownership.

3. Delete or correct the entry if verification can not be provided. 

Please also update me with the results of your investigation in writing within 30 days as required by the FCRA. 

I have enclosed a copy of my ID and proof of address for verification.

I am filing this complaint regarding Mr. Cooper 's mishandling of a mortgage recast request, which has resulted in unnecessary financial harm and raises questions about their business practices. 
After selling my other home, I contacted Mr. Cooper in early XX/XX/year> to request a recast of my mortgage using the proceeds from that sale. On XX/XX/year>, Mr. Cooper confirmed receipt of all necessary materials : My formal recast request The required recast processing fee A {$300000.00} principal payment intended for the recast Despite having everything needed to proceed, Mr. Cooper did not take timely action. On XX/XX/year>, I followed up via their customer service chat, concerned that delays would result in additional interest chargesdespite the principal payment already being in their possession. 
On XX/XX/year>, Mr. Cooper sent me a recast agreement indicating the new loan terms would not take effect until XX/XX/year>. This delay means I am required to make XXXX additional full monthly payments at the higher original amount, including interest on the principal that has already been applied. In effect, I am paying interest on funds that have already been used to reduce my loan balance. 
I immediately called to express concern and requested that the recast be made effective as of XX/XX/year>, which I believe is a fair and reasonable compromise given that all documentation and funds were submitted by XXXX. My request was denied, and the representative was unable to provide any substantive justification for the XX/XX/XXXX effective date. 
I believe this delay is financially punitive to borrowers and disproportionately benefits the servicer by allowing them to collect interest unnecessarily. Mr. Cooper 's actions demonstrate, at minimum, a lack of transparency and urgency in servicing customer requests, and at worst, a conflict of interest in retaining interest income at the borrowers expense. 
I am requesting that this matter be investigated and that Mr. Cooper be held accountable for their practices in handling mortgage recast requests. I am also seeking reimbursement or credit for the additional interest charged as a result of the delayed effective date.

Blacks Law Dictionary,  9th Edition, 2009, defines Verify as, 1 ) " To prove to be true ; toconfirm or establish the truth or truthfulness of ; to authenticate. '' 2 ) to confirm or substantiate by oath or affidavit ; to swear to the truth of.  '' and Verification as, Confirmation of correctness, truth or authenticity, by affidavit, oath, or deposition. Affidavit of truth of a matter stated and object of verification is to assure good faith in averments or statements of a party. What this means is that your company must be willing and able to produce a document in your files that proves the account ( s ) in dispute belong to me and the information being reported is accurate and you must be able to do this in a court of law if I file a lawsuit against you. Someone in your company must authenticate the documents in your files that were used to verify the disputed accounts and to do this they must have 1st hand knowledge of the alleged account ( s ) and all that has ever transpired for the alleged account ( s ), under oath and under the penalty of perjury. As I am sure that you are well aware, current Federal case law states that, Consumer Reporting Agencies bear grave responsibilities to ensure the accuracy of the accounts they report on and their responsibility must consist of something more than merely parroting information received from other sources. The Courts have also ordered that a Reinvestigation that merely shifts the burden back to the consumer and the credit grantor can not fulfill the obligations imposed by 1681 ( a ) ( 4 ). You have ignored my request to provided me with the documents that you have in your files that you used to verify the disputed accounts which means that you have NOT verified or you can not verify any of these accounts and under Section 611 ( 5 ) ( A ) of the FCRA you are required to promptly DELETE all information which can not be verified. ( 3 ) Rule of construction Nothing in this subsection shall be construed to prohibit -- ( A ) The repurchase of a debt in any case in which the assignee of the debt requires such repurchase because the debt has resulted from identity theft ; ( B ) the securitization of a debt or the pledging of a portfolio of debt as collateral in connection with a borrowing ; or ( C ) the transfer of debt as a result of a merger, acquisition, purchase and assumption transaction, or transfer of substantially all of the assets of an entity.

Consumers also complain that Defendants pursue them for collection of old debts for which they do not have any records and are beyond the statute of limitations and credit reporting periods. When a citizen contacts Defendants to dispute a debt or the amount of the balance owed, or to ask for additional information, little or nothing is done to investigate or verify the legitimacy of the debt. 
9.5 Consumers complain that when they tell Defendants they do not owe the debt Defendants refuse to provide documentation to verify the debt and turn the tables on the consumer to prove the debt is not owed or not owed in the amount alleged. Consumers complain that this practice has resulted in loss of credit rating, inability to refinance their homes, and even loss of job opportunities, in addition to the aggravation of being harassed by a debt collector who refuses to verify the debt. In late XX/XX/2021, the PHH Morgage company reported my account 30 days late. I made a payment on their electronic phone line on or about XXXX XXXX. A few days later I realized that my payment had not been drafted from my account and I called them. I was informed that there was a payment that had been rejected. I contacted my bank to verify this information and they told me that no payment had been attempted from the mortgage company. At that point it was after my 15 day grace period so I was worried about late fees. I called the Morgage company to make a payment and tell them about what was going on in an attempt to get the fees waived. After all, we are in a pandemic and every XXXX  mattered. They told me no they would not waive the fee and that I needed to make the payment right away. I made the full payment right there over the phone with the rep. I woke up a few days later with a late payment notification from XXXX XXXX. I was very upset because I had been in contact with them about the issue. At that point, I called them multiple times only to hear that it was nothing they could do. I spoke to multiple managers about what happened and I was told to file a dispute with the credit bureaus. I asked the company for a letter from stating that my account was current and that it was in good standing and was never late. I added this letter to my dispute. XX/XX/XXXX Rent Recovery Solutions, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA, XXXX Account # XXXX Dear Collector, I am writing in response to your letter or phone call I do not believe that I owe this debt or what you say I owe. Pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, Section 809 ( b ), Validating Debts : If the consumer notifies the debt collector in writing within the thirty-day period described in subsection ( a ) that the debt, or any portion thereof, is disputed, or that the consumer requests the name and address of the original creditor, the debt collector shall cease collection of the debt, or any disputed portion thereof, until the debt collector obtains verification of the debt or any copy of a judgment, or
the name and address of the original creditor, and a copy of such verification or judgment, or name and address of the original creditor, is mailed to the consumer by the debt collector.

( emphasis added ) I respectfully request that you provide me with the following : 1. the amount of the debt ; 2. the name of the creditor to whom the debt is owed ; 3. verification or copy of any judgment ( if applicable ) ; 4. proof that you are licensed to collect debts in Maine ; 5. proof of the last payment made on the account.

I am asserting my rights under the federal and state Fair Debt Collection Practices Acts and the Fair Credit Reporting Act, including these rights : Because I have disputed this debt in writing within 30 days of receipt of your initial notice, you must obtain verification of the debt or a copy of the judgment against me and mail these items to me at your expense. You can not add interest or fees except those allowed by the original contract or state law.Any attempt to collect this debt without validating it violates the FDCPA.Also be advised that I am keeping accurate records of all correspondence from you and your company, including recording all phone calls, and I will not hesitate to report violations of the law to my State Attorney General, the Federal Trade Commission and the XXXX XXXX XXXX have disputed this debt. Therefore, until it is validated, your information concerning this debt is assumed to be inaccurate. Accordingly, if you have already reported this debt to any credit-reporting agency ( CRA ) or Credit Bureau ( CB ) , then you must immediately inform them of my dispute with this debt. Reporting information that you know to be inaccurate or failing to report information correctly violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act 1681s-2. Should you pursue a judgment without validating this debt, I will inform the judge and request that the case be dismissed based on your failure to comply with the FDCPA.

Finally, if you do not own this debt, I demand that you immediately send a copy of this dispute letter to the original creditor so they are also aware that I dispute the debt. 
Sincerely XXXX XXXX

To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to file a formal complaint against a debt collection agency that contacted me under false pretenses and potentially violated the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) regulations. 

Incident Summary : On [ insert date of phone call ], I received a phone call from a representative who failed to identify themselves as a debt collector. During the call : The caller asked about an account allegedly related to XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX. 

I acknowledged prior dealings with XXXX XXXX and explained that I had been told the matter would be written off. 

The representative insisted I still owed money and represented themselves in a manner that implied they were a lawyer or legal representative of the company. 

At no point did they disclose that the call was from a debt collector or that any information obtained would be used for that purpose, as required under the FDCPA. 

I requested debt validation via postal mail, not email, per my rights under the FDCPA and CFPB guidelines. 

The representative told me they were not required to send documentation via mail and insisted on email correspondence, despite my explicit refusal. 


Eventually, I did receive something by mail after ending the call, at which point it became clear the company was in fact a debt collector. 

Why I'm Filing This Complaint : Failure to identify as a debt collector at the start of the call. 

Misrepresentation or deceptive practices, including the implication that the caller was a lawyer or affiliated with one. 

Failure to honor my preferred communication method, as I explicitly requested written communication via U.S. Mail. 

Incorrect information about my rightsspecifically, the claim that debt validation no longer needs to be mailed upon request. 


I am requesting that your office investigate this matter and take appropriate action to ensure compliance with all consumer protection laws. 

Please let me know if additional information or documentation is required. I am prepared to provide a more detailed account of the conversation and a copy of the mailed communication I later received. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

On XX/XX/2021 I received a summons to appear in court for an alleged credit card debt from Midland Credit Management. I was later visited by the city police XX/XX/2021 regarding the original summons I received on XX/XX/2021 from Attorney XXXX XXXX, XXXX. From my understanding of consumer law, according to 15 USC 1692 ( e ) this section is titled false or misleading representation, Midland Credit Management is in violation of my consumer rights and I want to compensated for the damages which I am entitled to according to 15 USC 1692 ( k ). A law firm can not attempt to collect a debt on be half of the creditor. That's illegal because the states that law firms can not act as debt collectors. I sent a certified noticed to Midland Credit Management on XX/XX/2021 demanding them to cease and desist as well as an invoice for the violation. There are other violations that Midland Credit Management has conducted such as 15 USC 1692 ( i ) in which congress makes it clear that bringing legal action by debt collector is unauthorized and 15 USC 1692a ( 6 ) ( A ) ( C ) ( D ) ( 6 ). The term debt collector means any person who uses any instrumentality of interstate commerce or the mails in any business the principal purpose of which is the collection of any debts, or who regularly collects or attempts to collect, directly or indirectly, debts owed or due or asserted to be owed or due another. The term does not include - ( A ) any officer or employee of a creditor while, in the name of the creditor, collecting debts for such creditor ; ( C ) any officer or employee of the United States or any State to the extent that collecting or attempting to collect any debt is in the performance of his official duties ; ( D ) any person while serving or attempting to serve legal process on any other person in connection with the judicial enforcement of any debt. I will be invoicing Midland Credit Management for the additional violations conducted against me and sending it certified within 5 business days. Additionally, I do not owe this debt because there is no contract stating that this credit was extended to me by this debt collector. I also demand that this be removed from my consumer reports because I did not give permission to report anything on my consumer report ; it is unauthorized.

Originally, green tree servicing llc granted me a {$29000.00} loan for a pool at my residence. My income was approximately {$34000.00} per year and to make the loan work, he reported it at $ XXXX as memory serves. I was a single father at the time, stuck in a terrible adjustable rate mortgage, receiving no child support and working XXXX jobs. There was no way I should have been qualified for the loan. Yet Green Tree found a way for XXXX XXXX, who has since gone under, to put a nearly {$30000.00} pool in my now foreclosed on home. 
Since my foreclosure, I have remarried and after being served collection papers from a law firm that Green Tree apparently sold my loan to, I reached a settlement with the law firm to repay half the remaining balance, just over {$14000.00}. They worked with me and put me on a manageable payment plan that was scheduled to be fulfilled in XXXX 2016. However, with tax returns and yearly bonuses my wife and I were able to pay the balance earlier this year and it is my understanding this debt has been satisfied. 
Now I receive a notice in the mail that is a letter informing me that 'Federal and state law prohibit certain methods of debt collection, and require that we treat you fairly. ' This was received from Green Tree Servicing of XXXX, Arizona. This letter not only rekindles the sour taste I have from ever being qualified for a loan they had no business issuing, but also leads me to believe that they still have this loan as an active debt. Frankly I am hesitant to contact these people to find out what is going on because I simply have no trust in them, and I worry they may try to collect further, even after our settlement. 
I decided to write to the CFPB because they provided your website as an avenue to report shady collection practices. I feel everything this company has done has been shady and feel it is my right to inform your offices of my situation.

This letter is to raise concern about service I recently received from a Key Bank XXXX branch. I was cold called even though I am on the do not call list on approximately XX/XX/2016 by a Key Bank XXXX employee and was offered a personal loan for credit card consolidation in the amount of $ XXXX My wife and I discussed it for several days and decided to submit the application and speed up our process on becoming debt fee from 10+ years down to 5 years according to the verbal offer made on the phone. On XX/XX/2016 we submitted the application. We were denied the loan even though we met the banks pre-approval criteria. We were then offered a contingent loan if we refinanced our auto loan through them with a lower monthly payment. The existing loan was to be paid off approximately XX/XX/XXXX or XX/XX/XXXX of this year and was at a .9 % interest rate. The wife and I again discussed the options and decided that even though the term would reset the timeline to five years and increase the interest rate to 4.69 % from .9 % interest rate, including loan origination and paperwork fees it would be less than wat we are paying in interest for the credit cards in the long run with the closing of the personal loan that was promised. During the auto loan closing process we were again reassured that everything would be fine and the personal loan would be approved upon the completion of the auto loan. Once we completed the auto loan process our credit was ran for the third time and we then were told the underwriter denied / revoked the original contingent offer even though we met the Banks pre-approval guidelines. At this time our credit had been ran three times affecting our credit score greatly, the Branch manager then offered to close a loan in the amount of {$15000.00} when we returned from a memorial service the following week. We then said ok it 's better than nothing. I called on XX/XX/XXXX to set up the closing the Branch manager then stated we had to wait another 30 days to run credit again when implying on the phone that we would just be modifying the terms with no further credit pulls. At this time I stated they are not going to run my credit for the fourth time and they needed to honor the original contingent offer. The branch manager then stated he would see what he can do. After calling the branch for several days asking for updates finally the Branch manager responded with there is nothing we can do. At this time I feel that several violations have occurred and are as follows but not limited to, do not call list violation, Bait and Switch, False advertising, revocation of a written and verbal agreement altering a financial situation for the worse, and potentially more. In conclusion my wife and I did not go looking for this situation the Bank came to us to help us better our financial situation, however quite the opposite has happened. The bank has greatly altered my financial situation negatively by negatively affecting our credit score and making potently harder for future loans or lines of credit, further raising our percentage rate on the auto loan while also now adding loan origination and paper work fees with prepayment penalties if we pay the loan of early as planned. If we would have allowed the Bank to continue to pull our credit over and over they would have. Furthermore when we raised question as to some of the denial reasons they were then changed to fit the needs of the bank such as insufficient credit file, we have over 20years of credit file, and insufficient liquidity. Liquidity was not even discussed and they have no idea what I have in other banks and retirement institutions.. How can we continue to trust this institution after what has happened with no remedy offered.

In regards to 15 U.S. Code 6802 Obligations with respect to disclosures of personal information ( c ) Limits on reuse of information Except as otherwise provided in this subchapter, a nonaffiliated third party that receives from a financial institution nonpublic personal information under this section shall not, directly or through an affiliate of such receiving the third party, disclose such information to any other person that is a nonaffiliated third party of both the financial institution and such receiving the third party, unless such disclosure would be lawful if made directly to such other person by the financial institution. 
I do not consent to any third party obtaining non-personal information without my knowledge or notice. The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) was enacted to protect the confidential information on consumers ' credit reports from misuse, fraud, and theft. It gives consumers the right to ensure that the information on their credit reports is not only correct but private.

From : XXXX XXXX Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, Missouri XXXX Date : [ Insert Date ] RE : Formal Rebuttal to CFPB Response CFPB Case # XXXX Loan Number Ending In : XXXX I. FAILURE TO REBUT LEGAL NOTICE AND EVIDENCE Valons response dated XX/XX/XXXX, fails to acknowledge or rebut my attached and properly served NOTICE OF UNCONSCIONABLE CONTRACT. This 5.7 MB affidavit was submitted under penalty of perjury and included sworn allegations of : Title 12 banking violations ( 12 U.S.C. 84, 93a, 371 ) OCC regulation violations ( 12 C.F.R. 7.1004, 215.3 ) Deprivation of rights under color of law ( 42 U.S.C. 1983, 1985 ) Unjust enrichment, fraud, and lack of lawful consideration Valon did not dispute a single point. Silence equals agreement. Valon 's failure to rebut constitutes tacit admission, commercial dishonor, and lawful default.

II. ADMISSION OF NO CASH COLLATERAL DEPOSIT ACCOUNT Valon has admitted in prior correspondence that no cash collateral deposit account exists for the alleged loan. This confirms no lawful extension of credit occurred.

Under federal law : 12 U.S.C. 84 requires lending limits tied to actual capital or surplus.

12 C.F.R. 215.3 ( a ) ( 8 ) requires a legally binding commitment of funds.

Cotton v. PrivateBank, 235 F. Supp. 3d 809 ( N.D. Ill. 2017 ) confirms that claims of credit require proof of asset-based origin.

Federal Reserve operating procedures prohibit securitization and servicing without a valid originating asset.

Valons own admission proves that : No money of account or consideration was lawfully extended.

The transaction is a nullity under Title 12.

There is no standing to collect, foreclose, or report to credit agencies.

III. NO ORIGINAL NOTE = NO STANDING Valon has failed to produce the original, wet-ink promissory note.

Under controlling authority : Carpenter v. Longan, 83 U.S. 271 ( 1872 ) Carlin v. Davis, 332 F. Supp. 3d 876 ( S.D. Tex. 2018 ) UCC Article 3 A photocopy is not evidence of a lawful obligation. Foreclosure without the original note is fraudulent misrepresentation and violates 15 U.S.C. 1692e.

IV. CONDUCT UNDER COLOR OF LAW Valon is attempting foreclosure in XXXX XXXX, Missouri, a non-judicial jurisdiction that offers no constitutional oversight. 

This is a violation of : The 5th and 14th Amendments of the U.S. Constitution Missouri Constitution, Article I 2, 10, and 26 42 U.S.C. 1983 deprivation of rights under color of state law Valon is acting as a private actor under color of law, without lawful authority or a court order, which is a tortious abuse of process.

V. UNAUTHORIZED DISCLOSURE OF PRIVATE INFORMATION XXXX XXXX, XXXX, and Valon have : Shared personal financial data without consent, in violation of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( 15 U.S.C. 6801 et seq. ) Violated the Fair Credit Reporting Act Failed to comply with state privacy laws This disclosure is unauthorized and unlawful. You are liable for civil damages and injunctive relief.

VI. CFPB HAS FAILED TO PERFORM ITS STATUTORY DUTY The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) has also failed in its obligation to uphold federal law and protect consumer rights.

By forwarding my complaint to a known debt collector who has no lawful standing, the CFPB is aiding and abetting the unlawful collection of a debt.

The CFPB admits that it does not intervene in legal disputes, but it is still bound by : The Administrative Procedure Act The Fair Credit Reporting Act The Dodd-Frank Act ( 12 U.S.C. 5481 et seq. ) CFPB has failed to investigate the underlying illegality of the transaction, including : No cash collateral deposit No original note Unauthorized credit reporting Violations of Title 12 and OCC regulations By refusing to intervene while still facilitating communication between the borrower and the servicer, the CFPB has created a constructive agency relationship and is thereby complicit in the unlawful enforcement of a fabricated debt. This is a breach of public trust.

VII. PROPERTY IS PRIVATE, NOT UNDER FEDERAL FORECLOSURE JURISDICTION This is a private, non-commercial homestead not subject to foreclosure under : Title 12 U.S.C. 371 Article I, Section 10 of the U.S. Constitution ( contracts clause ) Missouri Constitution, Article I 2, 10, 26 Federal preemption under Title 12 bars state non-judicial foreclosure, especially when the entity lacks lawful authority to enforce the alleged debt.

VIII. DEMAND FOR INVESTIGATION AND ACTION You are hereby placed on final notice : Cease and desist all foreclosure and collection activity immediately.

Produce all lawful documents demanded, including the original note and proof of consideration.

Normally, a buyer in CA inherits the sellers tax basis and a supplemental tax bill that the buyer pays in the first year adjusts the sellers basis to the buyers basis. 

When a buyer takes an impound account for taxes, the originating lender should adjust for the actual basis, not retain the sellers basis ( which is often lower ). 

What Bethpage did, and escrow permitted here, was for us to inherit the sellers SELLERs XXXX basis, which was only {$1000.00} per year ( {$88.00} per month ). This borders on negligence because they all knew our impound account would get slammed with an adjustment at a day in the future. 

So we closed in XXXX of XXXX, for a 7 year fixed loan, with a monthly mortgage price of ~ {$5400.00}. A year and half goes by, and we are blindsided by " an escrow deficit '' and our new mortgage payment is now ~ {$6800.00}, which was automatically withdrawn in our most recent mortgage payment, introducing financial hardship to my family and I. 

Bethpage was HORRIBLE to work with before and after the closing of our home, but this " error '' is unacceptable, and appears to be a " bait and switch '' to make sure we closed, as we had shared prior that anything higher than the ~ $ XXXX payments would be too much for us, and we would not purchase this home.

On XX/XX/2025, I received a letter from Security Credit Services , LLC regarding an alleged account originally with XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX Account # XXXX, Security Credit Services Account # XXXX ). 

I dispute this alleged debt in its entirety. In their letter, Security Credit Services stated that they had ceased collection activity and updated the account as Disputed with the credit bureaus. However, they also claimed that the information I previously provided was not sufficient to determine fraud or identity theft and demanded that I send them a government-issued ID, police report, and FTC Identity Theft Affidavit.

Rather than simply asserting identity theft, I exercised my legal rights to request full debt validation and proof of ownership. Specifically, I sent them a written demand under : FDCPA 809 ( b ) Requesting the original executed credit agreement, full GAAP-compliant accounting ledger, Bill of Sale , Assignment Agreements, and any securitization documents if the account had been sold into a trust. 

UCC 9-210 Requesting the full chain of title identifying the Secured Party of Record and all transfers from XXXX XXXX to Security Credit Services . 

TILA 1638 ( a ) & 12 CFR 1026.1720 Requesting original Truth in Lending disclosures, payoff statements, and transfer notices.

GLBA 502 Requesting their privacy policy and disclosures of any sale, transfer, or securitization of my personal financial data.

To date, Security Credit Services has failed to provide any of the legally required documents proving ownership, chain of title, or accurate accounting. Without this information, they have no legal standing to collect or continue reporting the account to credit bureaus.

By continuing to report or attempting to collect without proper validation, they are violating : FDCPA 807, 809 ( b ) False representation of the debt and failure to validate.

FCRA 623 ( a ) ( 3 ) & 623 ( b ) Failure to update account status and conduct a reasonable investigation. 

TILA 1638 ( a ) & Reg Z Failure to provide material disclosures.

GLBA 502 Unauthorized transfer and use of my personal financial data.

UCC 9-210 Failure to identify the secured party of record and provide an accounting.

This letter is a formal demand that Resurgent/LVNV Funding immediately remove the inaccurate and fraudulent collection account you are reporting on my credit file. Your actions constitute a clear violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1692e ), which prohibits false, deceptive, or misleading representations of debt, and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ), which prohibits furnishing inaccurate information to credit reporting agencies. By knowingly and willfully reporting false debt, you are engaging in defamation of character and reckless disregard for the truth. LVNV and Resurgent have a documented history of losing lawsuits regarding unlawful collection and credit reporting practices ( see LVNV Funding, LLC v. Harling and other state-level cases ), and I am fully prepared to pursue litigation for damages, legal fees, and all other remedies if this tradeline is not removed immediately. Consider this your final notice before legal action.

I am filing this complaint against XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  regarding their handling of a debt they claim I owe to XXXX XXXX XXXX. Furthermore, this debt has been reported to credit bureaus without validation, negatively impacting my credit report. 
Summary of My Requests and XXXX XXXX XXXX : Debt Validation Request Sent and Received : On XX/XX/year>, I sent a debt validation request to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  via XXXX mail, which they received. Subsequently, on XX/XX/year>, I received another letter from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX but as of this date, they have not provided the complete validation of the debt I requested. This request, submitted within the XXXX period allowed under the FDCPA, specifically sought validation documents, including : Name and address of the original creditor ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ) , Transfer documentation verifying the ownership of the debt, Date of default and delinquency, Detailed breakdown of charges, interest, and payments, Confirmation of compliance with the statute of limitations, and Proof of their legal authority to collect in Illinois. 
Lack of Adequate Response and Documentation : As of the date of this complaint, I have not received the requested documentation to validate the legitimacy of this debt. This lack of response from Credit Control , LLC does not comply with the FDCPA requirement to cease collection until the debt is validated. 
Debt Reporting to Credit Bureaus in Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 : Despite not validating the debt, Credit Control , LLC has reported it to credit bureaus, damaging my credit history. Under FCRA, reporting a debt without adequate validation may constitute a violation, as it involves reporting potentially inaccurate or unverified information.

I have had an active Kohls credit card for years. I have used it and typically pay the balance in full. Over the years I have missed payments because I forgot to pay before the deadline or missed the statement ( in my defense Kohls sends so many emails ). In the past I have paid a late fee or interest but nothing had ever been reported a credit agency. On XX/XX/XXXX, I made a purchase using my Kohls credit in the amount of {$1.00}. This was first recorded on the XXXX statement with a due date on XX/XX/XXXX. I did not see the statement and it was again reported on the XXXX statement with a due date on XX/XX/XXXX. I again did not see the statement. I received an email of a missed payment on XX/XX/XXXX and promptly paid the balance. 

At the beginning of XXXX I pulled a credit report and my scores dropped by almost XXXX points and upon inspection it was because Kohls reported a delinquent balance. I acknowledge the payment was delinquent. But, I am confused why they decided to report that one and not prior missed payments. This is not the first time I have been two months late, but its the first time the balance was so low that they were unable to charge the {$25.00} late fee or significant interest. I assumed that based on our course of business there would be no further issues. However, I was wrong because they couldnt extract more money from me. In my opinion that is a predatory practice. 

I called Kohls and attempt to resolve the issue. The customer service agents were limited in their ability to do anything other than submit a request. I received a letter in a couple of weeks but all it said was there were no errors. I still am trying to figure out why they report items inconsistently. I agree that accurate reporting is necessary under our credit system. However, transparency and information asymmetries are also huge issues. Creditors should not be able to inconsistently report delinquent payments during the course of a relationship. Kohls coerces people into using the their proprietary credit card to access coupons or discounts. Baits consumers by providing leniency when they can extract fees or interest but then slams users when they can not. There is no worse feeling than having your credit wrecked over {$1.00}.

To Whom It May Concern : I am filing a formal complaint against Rubin & Rothman , LLC, regarding their alleged unfair and unlawful collection practices, as well as potential violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq. This complaint specifically addresses Rubin & Rothman, LLCs ( the collector ) attempts to collect on a debt purportedly owed to XXXX XXXX, and XXXX alleged issuance of a 1099-C form to the IRS without notifying me. 

1. Failure to Provide 1099-C Notification : XXXX XXXX . appears to have filed a 1099-C form with the IRS in relation to this debt. Under IRS rules, creditors who issue a 1099-C form must provide the debtor with a copy. However, I never received such notice, leaving me unaware of any potential cancellation of debt income reported to the IRS. This oversight may affect the legal status of the alleged debt and my credit report, which under the FCRA must accurately reflect all pertinent information related to a debt. 
2. Violation of Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : Rubin & Rothman, LLCs actions may be in violation of the FCRA, specifically : Inaccurate Reporting of Debt : The FCRA mandates that credit information must be accurate and complete ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ). Due to XXXX apparent filing of a 1099-C, Rubin & Rothman , LLC may be reporting a debt that has been discharged or forgiven, leading to a potentially inaccurate credit report entry. 
Failure to Provide Debt Validation : Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ), I am entitled to a validation of the debt. However, despite my request, Rubin & Rothman , LLC has failed to provide me with a debt validation letter, creating further uncertainty about the legitimacy of this debt. 
3. Improper Venue and Lack of Jurisdiction to Sue in New York : Rubin & Rothman , LLC has filed a lawsuit against me in the state of New York, despite the fact that I am a resident of Ohio. This filing is a violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692i, which requires debt collectors to bring legal action either in the district where the consumer resides or where the contract was signed. Since I do not reside in New York and did not sign the contract in New York, this lawsuit constitutes an improper venue and is thus unlawful. 
4. Lack of Authorization to Collect in New York : Rubin & Rothman , LLC has yet to provide evidence of their authorization to collect this debt in New York, where they have initiated litigation. Under the FDCPA, debt collectors are required to prove their authority to collect, especially when jurisdiction is in question. I request that they produce documentation establishing their right to pursue this debt collection in New York, in compliance with applicable state laws.

This letter serves as a formal notice that I dispute the validity and ownership of the debt you allege I owe. Pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692g, and Regulation F, 12 CFR 1006, I request immediate and complete validation of the alleged debt.

Under 12 CFR 1006.34 ( c ), your office is required to provide : A detailed itemization of the alleged debt, including : Original balance, interest, fees, payments, and credits ; The full name and address of the original creditor ; Date the debt was incurred or charged off.

Proof of your legal authority to collect, including : A full chain of assignment or title from the original creditor to Radius Global Solutions ; Copies of any assignment contracts, purchase agreements, or bills of sale ; A copy of the original signed contract or application creating the debt. 

Evidence that you sent a proper validation notice under 12 CFR 1006.34 ( a ) within five ( 5 ) days of your first communication. Failure to do so constitutes a regulatory violation.

You are further advised that under 15 U.S.C. 1692e and 12 CFR 1006.18, it is unlawful to misrepresent the legal status of a debt or your authority to collect it. Any continued attempts to collect, report, or otherwise pursue this debt without proper validation may be interpreted as a willful violation of federal law. 

Notice of Intent to Litigate If Radius Global Solutions fails to provide the requested validation and documentation within fifteen ( 15 ) business days, I will initiate legal action, which may include : Filing a lawsuit for violations of the FDCPA, Regulation F, and applicable state laws ; Seeking statutory damages, actual damages, and attorneys fees ; Requesting injunctive relief, including deletion of any tradelines and cessation of collection.

To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally submit a complaint regarding a debt claim reported by Trellis Company, which I believe violates my constitutional rights and has caused me undue harm. According to Article I, Section 10 of the United States Constitution, " No State shall ... make anything but gold and silver Coin a Tender in Payment of Debts. '' Based on this provision, I assert that any demand for payment not involving lawful gold or silver coin is constitutionally questionable. Furthermore, any alleged debt must be properly validated through a sworn affidavit under penalty of perjury, clearly establishing the debts legitimacy, its origin, and the identity of the original creditor. 

Despite these constitutional requirements, I was subjected to collection efforts and credit reporting by Trellis Company without ever receiving proper sworn validation. Although I submitted a formal request for verification of the alleged debt, no sworn affidavit or legal affirmation under penalty of perjury was provided in response. I consider this a direct violation of my rights and a contributing source of significant financial and reputational harm. 

I also reference XXXX XXXX XXXX, signed during the Trump administration, which states that the U.S. financial system should promote adherence to the Constitution and uphold standards of transparency and accountability. It is my view that Trellis Company 's conduct runs contrary to these principles and requires immediate oversight and redress. 

In light of the above, I respectfully request the following : That all records and account information related to Trellis Company be fully investigated and that any debt not validated by sworn affidavit be deemed invalid and uncollectible. 

That all negative credit report entries associated with Trellis Company be removed, along with entries from XXXX XXXX, with whom I am presently involved in a fraud caseCase No. XXXX well as any other inaccurately or improperly reported accounts. 

That the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau pursue appropriate enforcement or remedial actions to ensure full compliance with constitutional protections, proper debt validation procedures, and responsible credit reporting standards. 

Thank you for your time and attention to this matter.

The chain of title proving ownership and assignment of the debt Until such documentation is provided, * * you must cease all collection efforts, including phone calls, letters, and reporting to any credit reporting agencies * *, as required by * * 15 U.S. Code 1692g ( b ) * *.

Additionally, be reminded that * * attempting to collect on a debt without proper validation or legal ownership is a violation of both the FDCPA and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) * *, and may constitute fraudulent collection practices under federal and state laws. Be advised that it is * * not legal to collect on a debt that can not be validated or legally assigned * *, especially if sold by the original creditor for pennies on the dollar without full documentation.

If this account is being reported to any credit bureau, this letter serves as my formal dispute under * * FCRA 15 U.S. Code 1681i * *, and I demand it be marked as in dispute on all credit reports during the investigation.

Failure to comply will result in complaints being filed with the * * Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) * *, the * * Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) * *, and my * * state Attorney Generals office * *. I also reserve the right to pursue legal action and statutory damages of up to * * {$1000.00} per FDCPA violation * *, plus attorneys fees. 

This letter is a formal notice and should be treated as such. Please respond within * * 30 days * *, as required by law. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX
