The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( XXXX ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system. So whenever there is a violation under the FCRA, it impairs the efficiency of the banking system. This is a violation of my privacy with my consumer report, since I control what is listed and what is not. In the event that any accounts are reported without my written consent, that is considered identity theft. This is a violation of both 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2. This leads way to civil liability against the credit reporting agency for negligent and willful noncompliance under 15 U.S. Code 1681n, which allows for {$1000.00} per violation, for account listed without my expressed written consent.

This letter serves as a request for immediate investigation and resolution of these issues. I recently became aware that information about my account has been shared with third parties without my explicit consent. As you are aware, such actions may violate the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S. Code 1692c ( b ), which explicitly prohibits debt collectors from communicating with third parties in connection with the collection of a debt without the prior consent of the consumer or the express permission of a court. Additionally, I believe this conduct may be in violation of other applicable consumer protection laws, including but not limited to the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ), which restricts the sharing of nonpublic personal information with unauthorized third parties. I demand that you immediately cease and desist from sharing my personal information with any third party without my prior written consent. Furthermore, I request a detailed accounting of all entities with whom my personal information has been shared, including the nature and purpose of each disclosure. Under my rights as a consumer, I am demanding that you provide the original purchase agreement that substantiates this claim, including all terms and conditions that comply with applicable consumer protection laws. Additionally, I am requesting the Forward Flow Agreement, Chain of Assignment, Insurance Claim of Debt, and my signature agreeing to pay. If you are unable to produce this documentation, I expect this matter to be closed and any negative reporting to be removed immediately from my credit profile. Furthermore, I was never offered arbitration regarding this matter, which is a fundamental right under various consumer protection statutes. Your failure to provide such an option is a direct violation of fair debt collection practices and due process. Any attempt to continue pursuing this matter without proper validation will be considered an act of bad faith and will be met with legal action if necessary. I expect a response within 30 days from the date of this letter. What I received from my initial complaint was not what was requested.

my rights have been violated according to the FDCPA, 15 usc 1692. As the original creditor and natural person i did not give this company permission to report any of my personal information to any consumer reporting agencies. According to 15 usc 1692d ( a ) ( 2 ), a company can not report anything negative to my consumer report that will ruin my reputation. The FCRA, 15 usc 1681, states our consumer reports represent us. Therefore, they are ruining my reputation. 15 usc 1666 they can not report alleged late payments to my consumer report.

These alleged late payments have not been validated, according to 15 usc 1692g it has to be validated for it to be put on a consumer report.

US DEPT OF EDUCATION/XXXX  incorrectly displays as current ... .. I fought for a year to get you to realize that " Payment Status '' vs " Last Know Payment Status '', is the issue ... I would not be disputing this entry as incorrect or through a federal oversight bureau if it calculated correctly as " Last Known Payment Status '' ... THE CREDIT BUREAU COMPUTERS SEE THIS ENTRY AS CURRENT! ... An example, Equifax now shows me this ... Things that are helping your credit = " none of your accounts have a delinquent or derogatory status. '' Things that are hurting your credit = " too many accounts with delinquent or derogatory status '' ... They don't know if I'm coming or going. Come anywhere near me and they send up fireworks sirens and red flags ... DON'T TOUCH! ... I am labeled Unworthy, Undesirable and Unhirable ... Again ... ... YES, The formulas and calculations should default to the date the account closed ... " Status '' or " Payment Status '' does not ... THE STATUS ENTRY IS THE CURRENT STATUS OF THE ACCOUNT. THE CLOSED ENVELOPE HAS NO EFFECT ON THIS ENTRY ... The bureau computers now calculate this account as currently in default 145 days x 5 years ( Squared ) and me as Delinquent x infinity ... I'm just another XXXX trying to get out of paying his student loan, huh! ... You have caused me to work extremely hard and long in the past to get someone to acknowledge this truth and finally rectify this issue and, what?, no notes were left behind? ... That alone should be considered negligence ... But if there were notes, and they were ignored ...?!!! ... It was agreed, this was the problem and steps were taken to fix it ... The results as I saw them ; I surmised that there is no " Last Known '' provision available for the status entry as " 120 - 149 days late '' was removed, the status entry was left blank and a notation was added showing, " last known status was 120 days late '' ... Because apparently it's vital to our nations security to make absolutely sure everyone knows that I defaulted on a student loan ... ... In order to be reported in a Fair and Truthful manner, the status on all of my previous Dept of Ed loans should read " Consolidated/Paid in full - See XXXX XXXX '' ... ... See the attached document - Stafford Loans Breakdown - provided to me by XXXX XXXX as representing all of the accounts that they absorbed ... Perhaps the roots of the the problem lay here, in the Direct Stafford entries, " DEFAULTED UNRESOLVED STANDARD REPAYMENT Current Servicer DEBT MANAGEMENT AND COLLECTIONS SYSTEM '' ... To me, it looks as if maybe Stafford did not update their entries after the consolidation paid them off ... But what do I know ... I attempted to attach the Credit Reference Letter XXXX XXXX included with the loan breakdown document and a copy of the consolidation loan agreement itself ... It seemed they were not allowed ... Provide me with an email address and I will share those documents with you along with a summarized but detailed history of this loan and how it has affected my life over the last two decades ... ... I have worked very hard to recover from defaulting on that loan ... You had finally realized the issue, fixed the problem and allowed me to move forward ... I struggled and clawed my way up ... I had almost reached the status of good ... It was within reach and just in the nick of time ... You don't understand this but EVERYTHING was riding on hitting those numbers by mid XXXX ... I had no choices left ... I had one roll ... It was the the only process available to me for securing a home for my wife and I ... I was actually confident ... I had done everything right ... I had done everything that could be done ... My numbers were going to hit the target ... I knew this in my soul ... I took my shot ... ... You bur n't my world to the ground ... Why? ... " Because, the Fair Credit Reporting Act says we can '', is the answer I'm given ... What is fair in this? ... The Fair Credit Reporting Act says you can ... It doesn't say you should ... Did someone say you must? Cause that's the person I want my sights on ... But why would you? ... What purpose does it serve to restore a defaulted status and numerous late entries other than to intentionally destroy someones credit and their life? ... Who benefits? ... Why me? ... Why now? ... Why choose to do this while my world is already set ablaze as I mourn my mothers loss? ... ... ... You have almost won ... I almost gave up last night and XXXX XXXX XXXX ... I see no other possible outcomes that you could expect to result from this action so I assumed you wanted to know that ... ... ... It is with absolutely no hope ... With no faith in the system or humanity whatsoever ... With my last gasp ... I Plead ... Mercy.

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX  XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX XXXX To : TransUnion LLC XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Subject : Formal Dispute and Request for Immediate Deletion of Fraudulent Account and Method of Verification To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally dispute and request the immediate deletion of an account that appears on my credit report. I am also demanding a detailed explanation of your method of verification, as well as any and all proof and documentation obtained during your so-called investigation of this account. 

The account in question has been reported without proper verification, which constitutes fraud under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, 15 U.S.C. 1692i. Your records must include verified documentation proving that the reporting party had a legitimate basis to place this information on my credit profile. If you can not provide this, then you are legally obligated to delete the account immediately. 

You are further required under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) to provide me with the following : The name, address, and telephone number of each furnisher of information you contacted during your investigation. 

A full description of the method of verification used to confirm the accuracy of the information. 

Copies of all documents, records, and correspondence you relied upon during your investigation. 

Failure to comply with these requests, or continued reporting of unverifiable information, will constitute willful noncompliance with federal law and subject your agency to legal action and regulatory complaints. 

I am demanding this fraudulent and inaccurate account be removed from my credit file immediately and that you provide written confirmation of its deletion within 15 days of receiving this letter. 

Please be advised that I will not hesitate to file formal complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and my legal counsel if this issue is not resolved without delay. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

This letter serves as a formal dispute of a debt your company claims to own or collect on. I do not acknowledge this alleged debt as valid and demand strict proof of your authority to collect under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692, and Regulation F, 12 CFR 1006.

Pursuant to 12 CFR 1006.34 ( c ) and 1692g ( b ), I request the following : Complete validation of the alleged debt, including : A full itemization showing the original balance, interest, fees, payments, and credits ; The full name and address of the original creditor ; Date of default or charge-off. 

Proof of ownership and legal right to collect, including : A complete chain of title or assignment history from the original creditor to Springs Oak Capital ; Copies of purchase agreements, contracts of assignment, or bills of sale ; A copy of the original signed agreement or credit application that created the alleged obligation. 

Proof of proper debt notification in accordance with 12 CFR 1006.34 ( a ) including whether you sent a validation notice within five ( 5 ) days of your initial communication.

Absent this documentation, you are not legally authorized to pursue collection or credit reporting activities. Any continued attempt to collect without sufficient proof of ownership and authority will be deemed a willful violation of : 15 U.S.C. 1692e false or misleading representations ; 15 U.S.C. 1692f unfair or unconscionable means to collect a debt ; 12 CFR 1006.18 deceptive representations about legal status or authority.

Intent to Litigate If your office can not provide full validation and documentation within 15 business days, I will take legal action to : Seek declaratory relief that the debt is invalid or uncollectible, Pursue damages for violations of the FDCPA, Regulation F, and applicable state consumer protection statutes, Demand injunctive relief including tradeline deletion and cessation of collection.

In addition, I have preserved my right to compel arbitration or file a civil action in state or federal court as appropriate. You are hereby placed on notice that failure to comply may result in formal legal proceedings.

If no sufficient response is received, your silence will be treated as failure to validate, and I will proceed accordingly.

( a ) Block. Except as otherwise provided in this section, a consumer reporting agency shall block the reporting of any information in the file of a consumer that the consumer identifies as information that resulted from an alleged identity theft, not later than 4 business days after the date of receipt by such agency of ( 1 ) appropriate proof of the identity of the consumer ; ( 2 ) a copy of an identity theft report ; ( 3 ) the identification of such information by the consumer; and ( 4 ) a statement by the consumer that the information is not information relating to any transaction by the consumer. ( b ) Notification. A consumer reporting agency shall promptly notify the furnisher of information identified by the consumer under subsection ( a ) of this section ( 1 ) that the information may be a result of identity theft ; ( 2 ) that an identity theft report has been filed ; ( 3 ) that a block has been requested under this section; and ( 4 ) of the effective dates of the block. ( c ) Authority to decline or rescind. ( 1 ) In general. A consumer reporting agency may decline to block, or may rescind any block, of information relating to a consumer under this section, if the consumer reporting agency reasonably determines that ( A ) the information was blocked in error or a block was requested by the consumer in error ; ( B ) the information was blocked, or a block was requested by the consumer, on the basis of a material misrepresentation of fact by the consumer relevant to the request to block ; or ( C ) the consumer obtained possession of goods, services, or money as a result of the blocked transaction or transactions. ( 2 ) Notification to consumer. If a block of information is declined or rescinded under this subsection, the affected consumer shall be notified promptly, in the same manner as consumers are notified of the reinsertion of information under section 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( B ) of this title. ( 3 ) Significance of block. For purposes of this subsection, if a consumer reporting agency rescinds a block, the presence of information in the file of a consumer prior to the blocking of such information is not evidence of whether the consumer knew or should have known that the consumer obtained possession of any goods, services, or money as a result of the block. ( d ) Exception for resellers. ( 1 ) No reseller file. This section shall not apply to a consumer reporting agency, if the consumer reporting agency ( A ) is a reseller ; ( B ) is not, at the time of the request of the consumer under subsection ( a ) of this section, otherwise furnishing or reselling a consumer report concerning the information identified by the consumer ; and ( C ) informs the consumer, by any means, that the consumer may report the identity theft to the Bureau to obtain consumer information regarding identity theft. ( 2 ) Reseller with file. The sole obligation of the consumer reporting agency under this section, with regard to any request of a consumer under this section, shall be to block the consumer report maintained by the consumer reporting agency from any subsequent use, if ( A ) the consumer, in accordance with the provisions of subsection ( a ) of this section, identifies, to a consumer reporting agency, information in the file of the consumer that resulted from identity theft ; and ( B ) the consumer reporting agency is a reseller of the identified information. ( 3 ) Notice. In carrying out its obligation under paragraph ( 2 ), the reseller shall promptly provide a notice to the consumer of the decision to block the file. Such notice shall contain the name, address, and telephone number of each consumer reporting agency from which the consumer information was obtained for resale. ( e ) Exception for verification companies. The provisions of this section do not apply to a check services company, acting as such, which issues authorizations for the purpose of approving or processing negotiable instruments, electronic fund transfers, or similar methods of payments, except that, beginning 4 business days after receipt of information described in paragraphs ( 1 ) through ( 3 ) of subsection ( a ) of this section, a check services company shall not report to a national consumer reporting agency described in section 1681a ( p ) of this title, any information identified in the subject identity theft report as resulting from identity theft. ( f ) Access to blocked information by law enforcement agencies. No provision of this section shall be construed as requiring a consumer reporting agency to prevent a XXXX, XXXX, or local law enforcement agency from accessing blocked information in a consumer file to which the agency could otherwise obtain access under this subchapter

This is a request for validation made pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act. Memorandum in support A misrepresentation is an assertion that is not in accord with the truth. When a person enters a contract because of his justifiable reliance on a misrepresentation about some important fact, the contract is voidable. Misrepresentations can be either : 1. innocent ( not intentionally deceptive ) or 2. fraudulent ( made with the knowledge of falsity and intent to deceive ). Contracts induced by misrepresentation or fraud are generally considered voidable. This means that the person whose consent was not real has the power to rescind ( cancel ) the contract. The elements of misrepresentation and fraud are as follows - notice the similarities. ( authors addition ) Innocent misrepresentation Fraud 1. Untrue assertion of fact ( or equivalent ) 2. Assertion relates to material fact 3. Actual reliance 4. Justifiable reliance 1. Untrue assertion of fact ( or equivalent ) 2. Assertion made with knowledge of falsity and intent to deceive 3. Actual reliance 4. Justifiable reliance 5. Economic loss ( in a tort action for damages PARTS OF A LAWFULCONTRACT 1. Parties competent to contract The parties to a contract should be competent, being of the age of consent, of sound mind, not disqualified from contracting by anylawto which s/he is subject. A flaw in capacity may be due to minority, lunacy, XXXX, XXXX or kind. The parties should be of like kind, being eitherartificialLegal Entity and artificial Legal Entity,  orliving Man/Woman and living Man/Woman, allowing more than two parties butnevera mixture of these kinds. 2. Free and genuine consent The consent of the parties to the agreement must be free and genuine. The consent of the parties should not be obtained by misrepresentation, fraud, undue influence, coercion or mistake. If the consent is obtained by any of these means, then the contract is not valid or lawfully enforceable. 3. Full disclosure When negotiating a contract, full disclosureis the act of providing all material information, or telling the whole truth, about anymatterwhich may influence the decision-making of the other party or parties before they decide to enter into a contract. 4. Sufficient consideration Theconsiderationis something of value possessed by the parties that is brought to the contract table. This something of value is bargained for and given in exchange for a promise or a performance. The parties must eachreceive a benefitand eachsuffer a detriment.To be enforceable, a contract must have sufficient consideration. A contract is unenforceable if it has insufficient or unequal consideration without agreement. 5. Certainty of terms The Terms and Conditions of the contract must be fully disclosed and agreed upon, and must be certain and fixed, i.e. not variable as with interest rates.
6. Meeting of the minds Ameeting of the minds consensus ad idem, occurs between the parties when they recognise each other, understand their mutual obligations, and agree. Thismeeting of mindscan only occur between like kinds, beingLegal Entity with Legal Entity, orMan/Woman with Man/Woman.A corporation and another corporation may enter into contract by way ofaccommodation parties, and a sentient being and another sentient being may enter into a contract directly, but a corporation and a sentient being together can not enter into a contract as they are not of the same and equal kind. 7. Signatures or autographs Written contracts between Legal Entity actors must carry the wet inksignaturesof the parties, each wet inksignaturebeing anaccommodationfrom a Man/Woman. Written contracts between living Men/Women must carry the wet inkautographsof the parties, and/or living identification such as a thumbprint. Livingstandingis recognised by a thumbprint, or more often by anunambiguous declarationwith theautograph, such asauthorised agentwritten below.
8. Privity of contract A contract exists only between the parties. No third-party can obtain rights contained within a contract, or buy or sell a contract, without the express permission of the original parties. Best Regards XXXX XXXX cc Federal Trade Commission Key Concept 6 Misrepresentation and Fraud 1 A misrepresentation is an assertion that is not in accord with the truth. When a person enters a contract because of his justifiable reliance on a misrepresentation about some important fact, the contract is voidable. Misrepresentations can be either : 1. innocent ( not intentionally deceptive ) or 2. fraudulent ( made with the knowledge of falsity and intent to deceive ). Contracts induced by misrepresentation or fraud are generally considered voidable. This means that the person whose consent was not real has the power to rescind ( cancel ) the contract.
The elements of misrepresentation and fraud are as follows - notice the similarities. ( authors addition ) Innocent misrepresentation Fraud 1. Untrue assertion of fact ( or equivalent ) 2. Assertion relates to material fact 3. Actual reliance 4. Justifiable reliance 1. Untrue assertion of fact ( or equivalent ) 2. Assertion made with knowledge of falsity and intent to deceive 3. Actual reliance 4. Justifiable reliance 5. Economic loss ( in a tort action for damages 1. Untrue Assertion of Fact or Equivalent ( authors addition ) To have misrepresentation, one of the parties must have made : 1. an untrue assertion of fact or 2. engaged in conduct that is equivalent to an untrue assertion of fact. The fact must be a past or existing fact, as distinguished from : 1. an opinion or 2. a promise or prediction about some future happening.
The concealment of a fact through some active conduct intended to prevent the other party from discovering the fact is considered the equivalent of an assertion. For example, if Summers is offering his house for sale and paints the ceilings to conceal the fact that the roof leaks, his active concealment constitutes an assertion of fact.
Nondisclosure can also be the equivalent of an assertion of fact. Nondisclosure is the failure to volunteer information. Disclosure of a fact is required when : 1. the person has already offered some information but further information is needed to give the other party an accurate picture or 2. there is a relationship of trust and confidence between the parties or 1 Source of materials : Mallor, et al., Business Law and the Regulatory Environment : Concepts and Cases ( XXXX XXXX/XXXX , 11th Edition, XX/XX/XXXX ). Bold print, bullets, and numbers have been added to the Mallor text to indicate particular emphasis.
3. a party has access to information that is not readily available to the other party.
Transactions involving the sale of real estate are among the most common situations in which the duty to disclose arises. Most states hold that a seller who knows about a latent ( hidden ) defect that materially affects the value of the property has the obligation to speak up about the defect. For example, in a recent case a buyer contracted to purchase a house that was reputed, according the sellers, to be possessed with ghosts.
The sellers did not tell the buyer this fact. When the buyer learned of the houses reputation, he was granted the right to sue for rescission. ( authors addition ) 2. Materiality Innocent misrepresentation If the misrepresentation was innocent, the person seeking to rescind the contract must establish that the fact asserted was material.
A fact will be considered material if it is : 1. likely to play a significant role in inducing a reasonable person to enter the contract or 2. if the person asserting the fact knows that the other person is likely to rely on the fact.
For example, XXXX who is trying to sell his car to XXXX and knows that XXXX idolizes professional bowlers, tells XXXX that a XXXX XXXX once rode in the car. Relying on that representation, XXXX buys the car.
Although the fact XXXX  asserted might not be important to most people, it would be material here.
Fraud Even if the fact is not material, the contract may be rescinded if the misrepresentation was fraudulent. Fraud is the type of misrepresentation that is committed knowingly, with the intent to deceive. The rationale for this rule is that a person who fraudulently misrepresents a fact should not be able to profit from his intentionally deceptive conduct.
A person making a misrepresentation would be considered to do so knowingly if she : 1. knew her statement was false or 2. knew that she did not have a basis for making the statement or 3. made the statement without being confident that it was true.
The intent to deceive can be inferred from the fact that the defendant knowingly made a misstatement of fact to a person who was likely to rely on it.
3. Actual Reliance Reliance means that a person pursues some course of action because of his faith in the assertion made to him.
There must have been a causal connection between the assertion and the complaining partys decision to enter the contract.
If the complaining party ( 1 ) knew that the assertion was false or ( 2 ) was not aware that an assertion had been made, there is no reliance.
4. Justifiable Reliance Courts also scrutinize the reasonableness of the behavior of the complaining party by requiring that his reliance be justifiable.
A person does not act justifiably if he relies on an assertion that is : 1. obviously false or 2. not to be taken seriously.
One problem involving the justifiable reliance element is determining the extent to which the relying party is responsible for investigating the accuracy of the statement on which he relies.
o Classical contract law held that a person who did not attempt to discover readily discoverable facts ( e.g. public records - authors addition ) generally was not justified in relying on the other partys statements about them.
o The extent of the responsibility placed on a relying party to conduct an independent investigation has declined in modern contract law. Todays courts tend to place a greater degree of accountability on the person who makes the assertion rather than the person who relies.
5. Economic loss In tort actions in which the plaintiff is seeking to recover damages for fraud, the plaintiff would have to establish a fifth element : injury. He would have to prove that he had suffered actual economic injury because of his reliance on the fraudulent assertion. In cases in which the injured person seeks only rescission of the contract, however, proof of economic injury usually is not required.
Remedies Rescission As is true for innocent misrepresentation, the contract remedy for fraudulent misrepresentation is rescission. A person who rescinds a contract is entitled to the return of anything he gave the other party. He must offer to return anything he has received from the other party.
Necessity for prompt and unequivocal rescission Suppose XXXX  who recently bought a car from XXXX XXXX learns that XXXX XXXX made fraudulent statements to her to induce her to buy the car. She believes the contract was induced by fraud and wants to rescind. She must : 1. object promptly upon learning the facts and 2. must clearly express her intent to cancel.
She must also avoid any behavior that would suggest that she affirms or ratifies the contract, such as : 1. an unreasonable delay in notifying the other party or 2. continuing to accept benefits from the other party or 3. behaving in a way that is inconsistent with her expressed intent to rescind.
Damages The tort liability of a person who commits fraud is different from that of a person who commits innocent misrepresentation. A person who commits fraud may be liable for damages, possibly including punitive damages, for the tort of deceit.
In some states, a person injured by fraud can not rescind and sue for damages for deceit ; he must elect ( choose ) between the remedies. In other states, however, an injured party may pursue both rescission and damage remedies. In addition, a person injured by fraud in a contract for the sale of goods can both rescind and sue for damages.
Innocent misrepresentation Fraud Rescission rescission and/or tort action in damages Am Jur 2d - Contracts 1 0 New I. In General, A. Definitions, 1 - Contract A contract has been defined as an agreement to do, or refrain from doing, a particular thing, [ 1 ] upon a sufficient consideration. [ 2 ] Similarly, a " contract '' has been defined as an agreement, obligation, or legal tie by which a party binds itself, or becomes bound, expressly or impliedly, to pay a sum of money or to perform or omit to do some certain act or thing. [ 3 ] Also, a " contract '' has been defined as a private, voluntary allocation by which two or more parties distribute specific entitlements and obligations. [ 4 ] A " contract '' is an agreement between two or more parties that creates obligations that are legally enforceable by the contracting parties. [ 5 ] A " contract '' is an agreement between two or more parties creating obligations that are enforceable or otherwise recognizable at law. [ 6 ] A " contract '' is an agreement by two or more parties whereby obligations are created, modified, or extinguished. [ 7 ] A contract is an obligation which arises from actual agreement of the parties manifested by words, oral or written, or by conduct. [ 8 ] The term " contract '' has been held to include every description or agreement or obligation, whether verbal or written, by which one party becomes bound to another to pay a sum of money or to perform or omit to do a certain act. [ 9 ] The Restatement defines the term " contract '' as a promise or a set of promises for the breach of which the law gives a remedy, or the performance of which the law in some way recognizes as a duty, [ 10 ] and this definition has been adopted by some courts. [ 11 ] However, this has been criticized as a circular definition : it is the same as saying that a contract is a legally enforceable promise, but a promise is legally enforceable only if it is a contract. [ 12 ] A contract is not a law, nor does it make law : it is the agreement plus the law that makes the ordinary contract an enforceable obligation. [ 13 ] Caution : The following types of contracts are subject in some respects to special rules that depend on their formal characteristics and differ from those governing contracts in general : [ 14 ] contracts under seal recognizances negotiable instruments and documents letters of credit When used in its ordinary sense, the term " contract '' implies enforceable obligations. [ 15 ] However, in popular speech, the word " contract '' is frequently used as meaning the work done under a contract. [ 16 ] Observation : A contract is a verbal act that has a legal reality independent of the truth of any statement contained in it. [ 17 ] The right to perform a contract and to receive its profits and the right to performance by the other party are property rights entitling each party to the fulfillment of the contract by performance. [ 18 ] Under the Uniform Electronic Transactions Act, the term " contract '' means the total legal obligation resulting from the parties ' agreement as affected by the act and other applicable law. [ 19 ] The term " contract '' has a more specific and extended meaning than the terms " promise '' or " agreement. " [ 20 ] The existence of a contract is a question of fact. [ 21 ] Tallies or receipts [ 22 ] and invoices [ 23 ] are generally not contracts.

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> Resurgent/LVNV Funding XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX SC XXXX XXXX : Cease and Desist Communication Regarding Alleged Debt Re : XXXX To Whom It May Concern : Pursuant to my rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, specifically 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ), I am hereby demanding that you cease all communication with me regarding the alleged debt referenced above. 

According to this statute : If a consumer notifies a debt collector in writing that the consumer refuses to pay a debt or that the consumer wishes the debt collector to cease further communication with the consumer, the debt collector shall not communicate further with the consumer with respect to such debt You are therefore instructed to immediately stop all forms of contact with me, including but not limited to telephone calls, letters, emails, and any other means of communication. The only exceptions permitted under the law are : 1. To advise me that your companys further efforts are being terminated ; 2. To notify me that you may invoke specified remedies which are ordinarily invoked by debt collectors ; or 3. To inform me that you intend to invoke a specified remedy.

Please be advised that continued communication outside of the above exceptions will constitute a violation of federal law, and I reserve the right to report such conduct to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and my State Attorney General. 

This letter is sent in good faith and with the expectation of your full compliance with the law. I recommend you retain a copy for your records. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Subject : Complaint Regarding Debt Validation, Account Re-aging, and Demand for Removal from Consumer Report Jefferson Capital Systems To Whom It May Concern : I am writing to formally file a complaint regarding Jefferson Capital Systems located at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, for their failure to provide adequate debt validation as required by federal law. Additionally, I am concerned that Jefferson Capital Systems may be re-aging this account, potentially affecting my credit report and causing further harm. The companys actions have impacted my ability to make informed financial decisions, as the information provided by Jefferson Capital Systems is incomplete and inadequate. 

The following laws highlight specific consumer rights that I believe have been infringed upon in this case : XXXX. 12 CFR 1006.34 ( b ) ( 5 ) - Under this regulation, debt collectors are obligated to provide certain information about the debt in their initial communication, including details essential to identify the nature and validity of the debt. Jefferson Capital Systems failed to meet this requirement by not providing clear, specific, and sufficient information to validate the debt. 


XXXX. 12 CFR 1006.34 ( c ) ( 4 ) ( i ) - This rule requires debt collectors to provide certain validation information regarding the amount owed, including itemization and any fees, interest, or charges accrued since the debt 's last transaction. Jefferson Capital Systems has not itemized these elements in their communications with me, which constitutes a violation of my rights. 


XXXX. 12 CFR 1006.34 ( d ) - According to this law, the collector must supply a validation notice, detailing the rights I have as a consumer to dispute or request additional information about the debt. Jefferson Capital Systems has not provided a validation notice that meets these requirements. 


XXXX. 15 USC 1692g ( a ) ( 7 ) - The Fair Debt Collection Practices Act requires collectors to inform consumers of their right to dispute the debt. Jefferson Capital Systems has not adequately communicated this right to me, thereby infringing upon my rights under this law. 



Additionally, I am concerned that Jefferson Capital Systems may be engaging in a practice known as " re-aging, '' where the date of last activity on this account is manipulated to appear more recent. This could unfairly extend the statute of limitations and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, resulting in further damage to my credit. 

Due to XXXX XXXX XXXX with the above laws and my inability to determine the legitimacy of this debt, I am formally demanding that this account be removed from my consumer report to resolve this issue. I respectfully request that the CFPB investigate this matter to ensure Jefferson Capital Systems ceases any re-aging practices, removes the account from my report, and upholds consumers rights as stipulated under federal regulations. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. Please let me know if additional information is needed to assist with your investigation. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

I was contacted by PennyMac regarding an FHA XXXX XXXX. After agreeing to move forward, the terms discussed included bringing one months payment to closing. I locked in my interest rate at 5.99 %, and they estimated a closing date of XX/XX/XXXX. 
After locking my rate, communication from PennyMac was minimal. For three weeks, I received little to no updates. Despite repeated calls, my loan officer did not return any of them. I attempted to get clarity by speaking with the processing team, but they seemed unsure of the situation. 

Since XX/XX/XXXX, Ive been receiving emails indicating I would need to bring more cash to close. Every time I spoke with my loan officer prior to that, he reassured me that I only needed to bring one months payment. He told me not to worry and that he would figure it out. 

On XXXX XXXX days before the estimated closingI received a call informing me I would now need to bring two months of payments due to an alleged system error that failed to include the current months payment. When I challenged this and requested to speak with a manager, I was finally connected with one ( XXXX ) after a 45-minute wait. 

XXXX told a different story : that the increase wasnt due to a missed payment, but because my escrow went up. Even then, he admitted that the new amount still didnt add up. When I pressed further, he asked if I really expected to make only one month 's payment to close an FHA loan, implying that the original loan officer was wrong. I pointed out that this meant I had been misled. His response : Ill coach him not to say that again, which didnt address the core issue. 

I asked XXXX to review the call recordings where I was repeatedly told I would only need {$3700.00} to close. He dismissed the idea, saying he wouldnt listen to four hours of calls. Eventually, he offered a refund of the {$250.00} I paid to lock in the rate. 

This entire experience feels like a bait-and-switch. I strongly suspect theyre attempting to get out of honoring the 5.99 % rate I locked in. Changing the terms this close to closing, providing inconsistent explanations, and refusing to review recorded calls only confirms my concern.

Against : Transworld Systems & XXXX XXXX XX/XX/2025 I am submitting this complaint regarding a collection account in the amount of {$130.00}, originally owed to XXXX XXXX, and currently reported by Transworld Systems , Inc. ( TSI ) on my credit reports. 

I contacted both XXXX XXXX and Transworld Systems directly and clearly stated that I was willing to pay the full amount not negotiate, not settle for less in exchange for a simple written confirmation that the collection account would be removed from my credit reports upon payment. 

Both entities misled me, claiming that they can not remove the account from my credit report under any circumstances. That is not true. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), furnishers are not required to report to credit bureaus, and many furnishers have chosen to remove accounts as a goodwill deletion after payment. Their claim that they are legally prohibited from doing so is false and misleading. 

I find it unethical that a consumer trying to pay a debt in full is being denied a path to repair their credit. A paid collection still negatively affects a credit score, and lenders rarely differentiate between paid and unpaid derogatory items. In other words, consumers are punished either way, even when they try to do the right thing. 

This practice feels deceptive and anti-consumer. It discourages repayment by making the outcome pointless for the person trying to take responsibility. I feel this behavior undermines the purpose of debt resolution and credit repair entirely. 

Again, I was not trying to negotiate a discount. I called both companies with the intent to pay 100 % of the balance. I simply asked for a written statement confirming that the account would be deleted from my credit report once paid. I was told this was impossible due to law or policy again, neither of which is accurate. 

This kind of refusal and misinformation harms consumers and creates a no-win situation : either pay and still suffer derogatory marks, or dont pay and be labeled irresponsible. 

I respectfully request the CFPB to review these practices and investigate whether both companies are misrepresenting the law and harming consumers through deceptive and punitive reporting tactics. 

Thank you for your time and attention to this matter.

I declared XXXX XXXX bankruptcy in XXXX XXXX and the bankruptcy was fully discharged in XXXX XXXX. The primary reason for declaring bankruptcy was the XXXX mortgage on my former primary residence in WY, and the deficiency resulting from a severe decline in property values. The loan and any deficiency was included in my bankruptcy filing and discharged with the bankruptcy. The original creditor was XXXX XXXX XXXX, then XXXX, with loan servicing maintained by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, to the best of my knowledge. In XXXX XXXX, on the advice of XXXX separate attorneys and with their help, I deeded the property back to the creditors, with a deed drawn up by an attorney and filed by said attorney with the local record of deeds office in WY. Since the lenders had taken no steps to claim the property after more than XXXX months after filing the bankruptcy, and I was required to surrender the property to the lenders per my bankruptcy agreement, the attorneys advised me to take these steps. In XXXX XXXX, I received a letter from the original lender and loan servicer, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, informing me that the loan in question would be transferred to a new servicer, Bayview Loan Servicing , LLC ( " Bayview '' ). In XXXX XXXX, Bayview began contacting me via phone, mail, and certified mail, with requests to pay its loan that had been discharged in my bankruptcy. They sent demand notices, Making Home Affordable paperwork ( which is ironic, because I spent about XXXX years trying to use the Making Home Affordable program prior to declaring bankruptcy as a last resort - I just picked up another Making Home Affordable notice from Bayview, sent to me via certified mail, today ), notice of insurance placed on the property, statements of account, etc. I spoke to representatives on the phone on several occasions and explained the situation, and let them know that they were violating the Fair Debt Collection Act and federal bankruptcy law by contacting me. In addition I sent a certified letter to Bayview on XXXX XXXX, XXXX, explaining the situation and providing a copy of the bankruptcy discharge. The contact stopped for about XXXX months, then began again in XXXX XXXX, with similar contacts continuing on a regular basis. In XXXX XXXX I realized that Bayview had put a defaulted loan on my credit reports with the XXXX credit reporting agencies. I contacted the credit reporting agencies and had Bayview 's reports removed from my credit reports with all XXXX agencies. The Bayview contacts subsided for awhile in XX/XX/XXXX and began again in XXXX XXXX, at which point they increased in intensity, occurring regularly through yesterday. Again, I have spoken to a representative on several occasions, explained the situation, emailed documents to him, asked him to resolve the situation on his end, and explained that Bayview is violating the Fair Debt Collection Act and federal bankruptcy law by continuing to contact me. The contact continues. I spoke to an attorney 's office in my area yesterday, who advised me that my best course of action to make this stop is to file a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau. I would be very grateful for any help you can give me in resolving this matter. It has been going on for four years, is emotional and disheartening for me and my family, and I would very much like to put it behind me. Thank you in advance for your time and help.

I am filing this complaint against Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing for unfair and deceptive practices in handling my mortgage loan modification and foreclosure process, in violation of RESPA ( 12 U.S.C. 2605 ), the Homeowner Bill of Rights ( HBOR, Cal. Civ. Code 2920 et seq. ), and federal servicing rules ( 12 C.F.R. 1024.41 ). These actions have caused me severe distress, prevented me from curing my arrears, and put my home of over 15 years at risk of wrongful foreclosure on XX/XX/XXXX. 
Timeline of Events : XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX  : I paid {$160000.00} via XXXX XXXX XXXX to cure arrears, but Shellpoint continued foreclosure without crediting it properly. 
Ongoing since XXXX : I've sent 30+ certified debt validation requests ( latest XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  ) under FDCPA and XXXX XXXX XXXX blocking my ability to refinance/sell ( property appraised at $ XXXX with equity ). Name errors persist ( using " XXXX '' despite XXXX change notifications ).

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) emailed that my mod denial letter " isn't ready yet '' and would be mailed ( attached ). But on a call XX/XX/XXXX, she rudely claimed I was already denied, contradicting a letter I received stating my " full package '' is under active review ( attached ). XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  : Shellpoint verbally confirmed to me they placed the XX/XX/XXXX sale " on hold. '' XX/XX/XXXX : XXXX XXXX XXXX  ( trustee ) emailed confirming the file is " currently on hold as per Shellpoint 's instructions, '' but postponement will only happen " closer to the sale date '' once formal instructions arrive ( attached email chain ). Their foreclosure attorney left a voicemail and sent email verifying the hold in writing. 
XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  : Followed up with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX replied they'll " immediately postpone '' once Shellpoint instructs, but no update yet ( attached ). Despite this, public records still show the sale as active, creating confusion and panic. Shellpoint 's XXXX XXXX previously ( XXXX  ) gave " incorrect guidance '' to ignore the NOD, leading to a denied mod after months of reviewadmitted internally as needing " coaching '' ( prior complaint evidence ). 

Shellpoint 's inconsistent communication ( hold confirmed but not formalized ; mod " under review '' vs. " denied '' ) violates RESPA 's requirement for timely, accurate responses ( 12 C.F.R. 1024.36 ) and HBOR 's ban on dual-tracking ( Cal. Civ. Code 2924.6 ). Their rude, unhelpful XXXX ( XXXX ) fails the single point of contact rule ( 12 C.F.R. 1024.41 ). This isn't isolatedit 's a pattern of deception, as in my prior CFPB complaint.

I waited a few weeks and never received anything, so I called the company back, to be told I would now have to pay {$900.00} to settle the date. I explained to the young lady that I had called recently and they was suppose to send me something in the mail, but I never got anything. So she said she would send me something and I can call them back once I receive the letter to start making payments. She said that every time I call back they up the price. I explained to her that I have called numerous times in the attempt to receive something in writing from their company and that I would not make such a big payment over the phone to a company that I have no knowledge of. She began to become very rude, saying that their company does not work like that and they would not be sending me anything and that I would have to make a payment today or the debt would remain on my credit. I told her I was never told that, the company I worked with previously sent me info with no problem so what makes their company any different. I then asked to speak to someone above her, she nastily said I would have to call back because the person above her is n't in.

This increase may be entirely invalid due to the flawed XXXX transfer, which could void Shellpoint 's authority to make any changes, and it appears to breach the original modification agreement. Shellpoint has a documented history of mishandling loan modifications and rate adjustments, as evidenced by numerous CFPB complaints and a XXXX CFPB settlement requiring {$3.00} million in principal reductions for similar issues involving improper rate adjustments and servicing errors. The unauthorized rate hike has exacerbated my financial hardship, inflated my arrears, and resulted in overpayments for which I am owed a full refund, including interest on those amounts. 
Additionally, Shellpoint assigned me XXXX XXXX as a XXXX under XXXX and Regulation X to facilitate discussions on loss mitigation options. However, XXXX XXXX has been consistently non-responsive and hostile in prior interactions, as evidenced by the attached email chain from XX/XX/XXXX, where she repeatedly directed me to submit disputes in writing without addressing my concerns and stated that the loan was not assigned to a XXXXCcontradicting Shellpoint 's obligations. I also emailed the Loss Mitigation Department to confirm her status as my XXXX. As of today, XX/XX/XXXX, I have received no response whatsoever from either, in clear violation of requirements for an accessible, knowledgeable, and responsive XXXX This non-responsiveness and apparent hostility have severely hindered my ability to explore viable alternatives to foreclosure, such as a new loan modification, forbearance, or repayment plan, and demonstrate a pattern of poor service that makes continued assignment to XXXX XXXX untenable. 
Despite these unresolved servicing errors and my ongoing attempts to engage in loss mitigation, Shellpoint has proceeded with scheduling a non-judicial foreclosure sale for XX/XX/XXXX. This action is wrongful and premature given the chain-of-title defects, interest rate errors, lack of XXXX communication, and potential invalidity of XXXX servicing actions. Under XXXX, the sale must be postponed if a complete loss mitigation application is under review or if servicing errors remain unaddressed. Furthermore, on XX/XX/XXXX, I sent a Notice of Error/Qualified Written Request ( QWR ) via certified mail, demanding corrections, documentation, and a response within the statutorily required timelinesyet I have received no acknowledgment or substantive reply. Shellpoint 's practices align with widespread consumer complaints about deceptive foreclosures, rate mishandling, poor customer service, and systemic failures in complying with federal and state regulations. Please provide the following information : The name and address of the original creditor.

The amount of the alleged debt, including an itemized breakdown of principal, interest, fees, and any other charges.

A copy of the original signed agreement or contract that shows I agreed to assume this debt.

Proof that you are licensed to collect debts in my state.

A complete payment history, showing how the alleged amount was calculated.

Until you provide the requested documentation, and while this debt is in dispute, you must cease all collection activities, including reporting to any credit reporting agencies.

This request is not an acknowledgment that I owe this debt, and it is not a refusal to pay. I am simply exercising my rights under federal law to have the debt validated.

1. Description of the Problem : I am submitting this complaint to stop an illegal foreclosure sale scheduled for Wednesday, XX/XX/XXXX, on my property located at XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I sent a Non-Negotiable Notice of Debt Validation Request and a Notice of Qualified Indorsement to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX via United States Postal Service ( USPS ) and fax. These notices were sent in accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), the Rosenthal Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( RFDCPA ), and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ).

Under 15 USC 1692g ( b ) and California Civil Code 1788.17, all debt collection activities including foreclosure must cease, and once a debt is disputed in writing under validation is provided.

To date, no validation has been provided by any of the named entities. Despite this, the foreclosure sale remains scheduled for XX/XX/XXXX. 

2 : Legal Violations : The following laws are being violated by proceeding with the foreclosure sale : FDCPA ( 15 USC 1692g ( b ) ) : Requires debt collectors to cease collection until validation is provided. ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX is not a debt collector under the FDCPA but is covered under the RFDCPA ) Rosenthal Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( RFDCPA ) : Incorporates FDCPA requirements into California law.

Best v. Ocwen Loan Servicing, LLC ( 2021 ) 64 Cal.App.5th 568 : Confirms that nonjudicial foreclosure is debt collection under the Rosenthal Act.

TILA ( 15 USC 1601 et seq. ) : Requires clear disclosure of the creditor and terms of the debt and when that debt has been transferred.

California Civil Code 2936 : An assignment of deed of trust without the underlying note is void. A deed of trust follows the note. The note does not follow a deed of trust.

3. Actions Taken by Complainant : Sent Debt Validation Request to the foreclosing trustee, XXXX XXXX XXXX, on XX/XX/XXXX. 
Sent Qualified Indorsement Notice and Debt Validation Request to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. 
Sent Notice of Adequate XXXX of XXXX XXXX and multiple sworn affidavits to all parties.

All documents were sent via USPS Priority Mail with tracking and some by fax.

No substantive response has been received as of date.

Continued noncompliance and suspicious activity from Navy Federal Credit Union Mortgage Department. Please reference CFPB complaints XXXX and XXXX. 

After receiving the continuous emails from NFCU concerning a revised disclosure after my last complaint, I noticed a change in the loan officer assigned to my account. Not understanding, I reached out, and ask this person who they were and why are they now on my account. The response I received was that she was here to help with the complaints. 

That did not occur and its not occurring at all. Although she is very nice, her goal of trying to get me to use Navy Federal as my lender, in my belief to put suspicion on these complaints ( e.g. if I use them as a lender then how could they have done the things that Im accusing them of doing ), had nothing to do with resolving the complaints themselves. In fact, I was provided new and INCORRECT documentation in the form of loan estimates where a rate lock was applied because she had mentioned that it was something she could take care of. New documents were sent and they attempted to charge me for a lock but neglected to mark the correct boxes stating so. Also points were applied but no discount or viable explanation was given as to why I would be paying a higher rate, for a lock, that is not indicated on the loan estimate sheet. When I brought this to her attention, she eventually provided a loan estimate sheet that appears to be filled out properly, however it continues to support my belief of nefarious practices within NFCU. IF these are your best people and these are the people you have assigned to try to rectify any of the issues we have, then why are you still trying to price gouge me by applying a rate much higher than what I was quoted before, stating that because I did not lock at the time that any interest rate that increased is my responsibility to pay but neglect to note the reasons why such as your inability to explain what these rates are in a level where I can understand, and the bigger issue of your discriminatory practices! Then NFCU still presents their negligence and unwillingness to properly resolve any issues in the form of sending improperly filled out paperwork. NFCU should be required to explain why they are STILL sending improperly filled out documentation where for obvious reasons they are attempting to charge me for points and rate locks that they cant seem to figure out on their own in-house sheets. We can pretend, and keep calling these mistakes, but at what point are we going to call it what it is? Especially when Im being told these are your people to help resolve the issue so I must assume that they are the best people you can find to contact me. In their thinly veiled attempt to silence my complaints, Navy Federal is STILL trying to charge extra money one way or the other. Their actions continue to support my original complaint that there is something nefarious going on within their mortgage department and they have no desire or possibly ability to correct.

To Whom It May Concern, I am writing in response to a received on regarding an alleged debt XXXX/XXXX  XXXX  you claim I owe. Please be advised that I am requesting validation of this debt, as is my right under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, 15 U.S.C. 1692g. Pursuant to this law, I respectfully request that you provide the following information : 1. The name and address of the original creditor. 2. A detailed statement of the alleged debt, including the amount and how it was calculated. 3. A copy of the original signed debt collection agreement or contract. 4. Proof that you are legally authorized to collect this debt. 5. A full accounting of payments, interest, fees, and charges applied to the alleged balance. 6. A copy of the judgment ( if any ) or other documents proving your legal right to collect this debt. Until you provide proper validation, I am requesting that all collection activity cease, including any reporting to the credit bureaus. If this debt is being reported to any credit reporting agency, be advised that failure to validate may constitute a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), and I will take appropriate steps to dispute the entry. Please respond to this request within 30 days from your receipt of this letter. regarding an alleged debt you claim I owe. We received a letter from our mortgage lender, Caliber Home Loans, posted XX/XX/2022 in regards to our request for assistance. The letter was as arranged repayment agreement made between Caliber and my husband and I to bring our account current since we were unable to make payments for two months due to income reduction. The letter stated " The total Arrearage Amount due as of XX/XX/2022 is {$1000.00} ... the specific conditions of the agreement are as follows : XXXX. The first payment in the amount of {$920.00} shall be remitted ... on or before XX/XX/2022 XXXX. A subsequest repayment plan monthly payment is due on XX/XX/2022, in the amount of {$1300.00}... 
XXXX. Your scheduled repayment plan monthly payment is comprised of your current monthly payment of {$920.00}, and the supplemental montly payment in the amount of {$440.00}. 
XXXX. The scheduled repayment plan monthly payment shall remain at {$1300.00} effective XX/XX/2022 and will end on XX/XX/2022 ... '' Upon agreement, we made these three consecutive payments, one in a slightly larger amount of {$1100.00} on XX/XX/XXXX, one for the XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX and finally the last payment of XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. During this process we continued to receive statements showing that we were behind on our payments and I was assured that we were on target, that sometimes the computer system does not recognize the updated payments during a repayment plan. I called multiple times during these months to make sure my payment had been received and that starting in XXXX our monthly payments moving forward would be {$860.00}. By the end of XXXX when I paid my payment of {$860.00}, I was still getting calls that we were 30 days past due on our account. On XX/XX/XXXX, our loan officailly transferred to XXXX XXXX  after being aquired by XXXX. Since then, I have been on the phone a number of hours with XXXX trying to get answers on why we continue to be in default on our mortgage. If anyone could listen in on the recorded calls I've had regarding the situation, he or she would realize just how many " answers '' I got from Caliber and XXXX members that led down one rabbit hole after another. FINALLY, after my conversation this week ( Januarly XXXX ) with a XXXX  loss mitigation associate, I believe I received the answer to the problem, which brings me to filing this complaint. 

Upon looking at the arranged repayment plan, the associate easily discovered that Caliber miscalculated the amounts of the payments required for the months of XXXX through XXXX that would have brought our account current by the said date, XX/XX/XXXX. As stated above, this miscalculation of required payments has caused our account to be over 30 days past due for over half a year and has been a hard hit on my husbands credit score. This associate I talked with said there's nothing XXXX can do at this point since Caliber is no longer our mortgage lender. 

According to the repayment plan, we met ALL regulations stated in the agreement and Caliber is at fault for the discrepancy in calculating the amounts that were due.

RE : Formal Dispute Midland Credit Management Collection ( Acct # : XXXX ) To Whom It May Concern, This is a formal dispute of the information being reported on my credit file regarding a Midland Credit Management account ( Acct # : XXXX ). The account is listed as a collection account with a past due balance of {$4100.00} and a date opened of XX/XX/XXXX, with recent updates as of XX/XX/XXXX. 
This account is being disputed on the following legal grounds : 1. Unverifiable Debt Buyer Status FCRA 1681i & 1692g ( b ) Midland Credit Management is a third-party debt buyer. They are not the original creditor, and no documentation has been provided to verify the chain of title, legal right to collect, or original account details.

2. Account Reporting During a Declared Disaster FCRA 1681c & CARES Act This account reflects deferment from XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  to XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  due to a natural or declared disaster. Reporting negative or collection activity during that period may violate federal regulations and consumer protection laws. 
3. Inaccurate and Potentially Re-aged Reporting FCRA 1681c ( a ) ( 4 ) The account shows a date opened in XX/XX/XXXX, which is after the deferment period began suggesting re-aging of the debt or improper date assignment. 
4. Lack of Validation Documentation FDCPA 809 ( b ) As required by the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, a debt buyer must provide proper validation of the debt, including the original creditor name, amount, contract, and payment history. This has not been provided. 
DEMAND : I am requesting a full reinvestigation of this account. If Midland Credit Management can not produce full validation, including the original contract and itemized billing history, this account must be permanently deleted from my credit file. Please provide written confirmation of the reinvestigation results within 30 days.

United Wholesale Mortgage ( UWM ) refinanced my home on XX/XX/XXXX. Included within the refinance was an escrow account to cover my homeowners insurance. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I was notified by my homeowners insurance that my payment was past due and not yet received. At that point I submitted a request via UWM 's secure website asking why payment had not been made and that I was unable to determine that they had made payment via their website. 

I received a secure message back on XX/XX/XXXX from them stating that I can update my insurance information via a secure portal and they provided instructions to do so. As my insurance had not changed, and was still the same information they had on their online portal I determined this was an inappropriate response. 

Instead of moving forward with " changing '' my insurance information, I instead chose to call their XXXX main phone number for support later that day on XX/XX/XXXX. At that point, a gentleman stated that he too saw that my escrow account included homeowners insurance. He stated that the first payment they had indicated was for XX/XX/XXXX. I stated that as my home refinance closed in XX/XX/XXXX, and that UWM knew my insurance was up for renewal in XXXX, as determined by the XX/XX/XXXX due date, UWM should be aware that a payment was needed in XX/XX/XXXX. He agreed and said he would reach out to the insurance department for more information and call me back on Monday, XX/XX/XXXX. 

I did not receive a call on Monday, XX/XX/XXXX. 

I did not receive a call on Tuesday, XX/XX/XXXX. 

I called UWM back on Wednesday, XX/XX/XXXX. At that point I spoke with a XXXX who claimed that as the homeowners insurance was not funded at the time of closing this was not UWM 's fault. I stated that insurance was included within the escrow and she agreed. She then stated that UWM making this payment would impact my future escrow calculation. I stated that I understand that UWM made a mistake, but that the insurance must still be paid. I was comfortable with my escrow adjusting to make up for this error as these were still my funds to pay. As such, XXXX provided me with instructions on how to submit a bill to UWM via an email address and that a check would be overnighted to pay for my homeowners insurance that at this point was more than a week past due. I followed those instructions within the hour on Wednesday, XX/XX/XXXX and requested confirmation in the email for when the payment was sent. 

I did not hear back on Thursday, XX/XX/XXXX. 

On the evening of Friday, XX/XX/XXXX, I sent a reply to the auto-response email that I received on Wednesday XX/XX/XXXX from when I sent them the bill stating that if I did not hear back about payment being sent by noon on Monday, XX/XX/XXXX that I would be initiating this complaint with the CPFB. 

I still have not heard back and am unable to tell that my homeowners insurance has been paid. I don't understand how UWM can hold my escrow account hostage and not pay these bills.

XXXX/COMENITY/ULTA XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX OH XXXX Subject XXXX Debt Validation Request Dear XXXX/COMENITY/ULTA, I am writing in response to your recent communication regarding the alleged debt referenced in your letter. Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), Section 809 ( 15 U.S.C. 1692g ), I am requesting validation of this debt.

Specifically, I request the following documentation : 1. Proof of Debt : Copies of all records showing the amount of the debt, how it was calculated, and the original contract or agreement signed by me.

2. Assignment of Debt : Copies of all contracts or assignments that demonstrate your legal right to collect this debt, including any chain of assignment from the original creditor to your company.

3. Original Creditor Information : The name, address, and contact information of the original creditor, along with details about the account and any outstanding balance at the time of the assignment or sale.

4. Payment History : A detailed, itemized statement showing any payments made, fees added, and the balance still owed.

5. Statute of Limitations Verification : Documentation confirming the date of last payment and whether the debt is within the statute of limitations.

Until I receive the requested documentation, I dispute the validity of this debt. I also request that all collection efforts, including reporting to credit bureaus, be halted until this matter is resolved.

Please note that future communication regarding this matter should be in writing and sent to the address listed on file. Additionally, I request that you do not contact me by phone.

Thank you for your cooperation. I look forward to receiving the requested information within 30 days of your receipt of this letter.

I require direct and relevant information regarding my dealings with SAFCO, without any indirect irrelevancy. Please correct me if I'm mistaken and assist me in understanding the lending process. When a buyer approaches a dealership to purchase a vehicle, the dealer is aware that if the buyer lacks sufficient funds, they will likely need financing, correct SAFCO? The dealership acts as the seller but does not possess the funds for the buyer, so they contact their lenders to determine who is willing to provide a loan to the buyer ; this is referred to as indirect lending. Once the dealership identifies a lender willing to finance the required amount, is it accurate to say that the indirect lender is expected to provide the funds to the buyer for the vehicle they wish to purchase? Why are the funds directed to the dealership instead of the buyer? 

In this consumer/financial transaction, the funds were intended to be transferred to the buyer 's demand deposit account rather than the dealership 's account, correct? The funds were meant for me so that I could utilize them to finance the loan check and acquire the vehicle. Did I not have any entitlement to that? I need clarification on this matter. 

The dealership informed me that if SAFCO had provided the funds directly to me and I had chosen to use them for a different purpose instead of buying the vehicle, they would have incurred a loss and faced a greater risk. How is that possible if I intended to use the funds for the vehicle purchase? They seemed to believe that I would seek out a less expensive vehicle and pocket the remaining amount or not getting the vehicle at all. Is that really how you view us consumers?

Pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), a consumer reporting agency is required to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation of any disputed item and delete or correct any information found to be inaccurate or unverifiable. Additionally, 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) prohibits a furnisher of information from reporting information it knows or should know is inaccurate, and 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( b ) imposes an affirmative duty on furnishers to conduct a reasonable investigation upon notice of a dispute and to delete or modify any unverifiable data.

Further, under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692e prohibits the use of false, deceptive, or misleading representations in the collection of a debt, and 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ) mandates that a debt collector cease collection activities until verification of the debt is provided when a timely dispute is submitted. Credence has never provided any form of written verification or documentation substantiating the validity of this debt despite the statutory obligations under the FDCPA and FCRA.

This inaccurate and unverified reporting constitutes a willful violation under 15 U.S.C. 1681n, for which I am entitled to statutory damages of up to {$1000.00} per violation, and a negligent violation under 15 U.S.C. 1681o, for which I may recover actual damages, costs, and attorneys fees. Under 15 U.S.C. 1692k, the FDCPA also allows recovery of statutory damages of up to {$1000.00}, along with actual damages, costs, and attorneys fees.
